bushwackersand

resp.text: Hi Diane - Thank you for taking time to let us know about your recent visit to the Flora-Bama Oyster Bar & Restaurant. On behalf of our team, I want to extend my sincerest apologies for the experience you all had. I'm not one to make excuses but it seems you may have caught us at a "not so great" moment. We have been in the midst of changes mandated by the state of Florida which were released in the afternoon this past Friday, June 26th, 2020; and our staff has been working hard over the weekend to convert our business operations back from bar to restaurant. Regardless, that in no way should reflect in the service and/or food and drink consistency. Please know your comments have been passed to upper management for further review and action. We do hope to have you all back for a better experience and in effort to make things right. Again, thank you for the feedback and we hope to have you all back again soon.

name: Jackson Telano
text: I’m 19 years old and wanted to see what a bar was like with my family, but at the ticket booth they said you needed to be 21 durning COVID-19... there was only 10 signs saying you had to be at least 18! Congratulations on turning down 10 adults and one young adult! They’ll turn down all people under 21! Very frustrating and a waste of vacation time! Save yourself time and just go somewhere else. I also provided ID!!!!

resp.text: Hey there - Thanks so much for letting us know about your recent experience visiting the Flora-Bama. Please let us extend our sincerest apologies for the miscommunication in information regarding our age and cover charge  policy. As of June 3rd, the state of Florida issued a lift on all bar and nightclub operations, therefore we were given less than 48hrs to implement changes across all properties in order to open back up our inside rooms and bars. On Friday, June 5th we began going back to our previous hours of operation with the Flora-Bama being family-friendly until 6PM and after 6PM all those under 21yrs of age must exit the premises. This past Friday, June 12, we began going back to a cover charge after 6PM for all those 21yrs and older. Our website was not updated until Friday, June 12 and I'm so, so very sorry for the inconvenience it caused you. With all changes happening so quickly and no advance warning as to what the state of Florida governor will be announcing on any given day, our staff has been working extremely hard to adapt and we now have all signage regarding age and cover policy covered up so that no one is misinformed. Of course with all recent changes our country has experienced in the last few months, we are all in the same boat and doing our best to push info out as soon as we can in order to keep our patrons informed. If you're not already, give us a follow on our Facebook and Instagram where we post any all updates regarding upcoming events, happenings and operation changes. Again, we apologize for the inconvenience and please know updates have not only been made on the website and all other informational fronts, but your comments have also been passed to upper management for further review. We do hope to have ya'll back for a better experience as we'd love the opportunity to make things right!

resp.text:
Hi Sara - Thank you for taking time to let us know about your recent visit to the Flora-Bama. On behalf of our team, please let me start by extending my sincerest apologies for the treatment you received from some of our staff. We absolutely do not tolerate this sort of behavior from our employees, and I would like to get a little more info from you if possible. Can you tell me what day/time you were here, any sort of description of what they looked like and/or where in the Flora-Bama did this occur?
Please know your comments have been passed to upper management, as well as our Ownership Team, for further review and action and, any additional info you may have would be helpful so that we may address this with the appropriate staff. Again, I'm so very sorry this happened but I would love to try and make things right. Please feel free to reach out to me directly with any other info you have using the following email address: blakeli@florabama.com.
I hope to hear back from you soon - Blakeli Calvert, Marketing Manager Flora-Bama

name: Stephanie Melton
text: I love the Flora-Bama. We ate at the yacht club this evening. We had Patron margaritas and grilled fish tacos.  I could not haveasked for more.  Great service good food, respectful yet fun crowd . The accommodations for dealing with covid were great.

name: C S
text: Great, fun place definitely recommend stop

name: Jimmy Taylor
text: A must when in the area. Different bands playing all the time

name: Heather Woods
text: It was a lot of fun here. It was unfortunate the  bouncers kept grabbing my wrist without asking to look at my stamp. (It had  washed away when I washed my hands in the bathroom) I had to show my ID 5x and didn't care to have random bouncers grab my wrists.  Invest in bands or a permanent marker!

name: Stephen Como
text: The place to party the night away.  Weekends, special events and when the "tourist season" is here it gets CRAZY and extremely busy. Live music in the various different rooms, reasonably priced drinks, and definitely and place to meet new friends. The police do make this place a priority to keep everyone safe and keep eye out for driving under influence so please keep this in mind. Also, there is a Church service on the beach early Sunday mornings then back inside for a drink. Enjoy!

name: Ben Taylor
text: Great burgers & fries. The patio was amazing at the beginning of May. Will definitely be coming back!

name: John Hohmann
text: Doing a great job at keeping us entertained, even during this COVID challenge.

name: Mandy Snell
text: Great food,  56 year old landmark, but really hot in August.

name: brandy ford
text: Unique place. I loved the 1,000 of bras all over the place. The liquor room for "On Tap" liquor was pure genius.

name: margie alabise
text:
We had a blast. We were upstairs in the Main Bar and from 6-10 we listened to Trevor Finley and he was fantastic! We had a great time. A few hard ciders and our server was Liz and she was on point. It was a great experience and we will definitely be going back while we are here for 3 mo.
Great place and so iconic!

name: Jimmy Alford
text: We saw Santa sky dive from a plane and land on the beach

name: Jim Robertson
text: This is a great place to go while you're in Gulfshores. It has a lot of history to see and the people who work there are awesome. Great place to go for food and drinks. They have really good bands in performing great music you can have a lot of fun there

text:
Great bands, amazing atmosphere. One of the must visits.
Limited food options but again, that's not what you're here for.
The cocktail selection was good.
There's a souvenir shop as well but not well priced. (I'm unaware if the proceedings go for charity but with those prices I'd hope that's the case)

resp.text: So glad you all had a large time! Hope to see ya back here on the line soon!

name: Betty Colquitt
text: Absolutely great

name: Dr. Chednicks' cheeses
text: A good place to grab a drink in the afternoon and a great place to get drunk in the evening. Not so much a place to grab a bite to eat and have one beer since the menu is limited. The Yaught club and ole river grill across the street have a more full menu and sit down service, while the Flora-Bama has a order window. It was confusing to tell where to go since the main entrance leads into a souvenir shop. Outside of the souvenir shop is a split for the upper level and the oyster bar. I found my way past some tents and found the order window and sat on the lower outside deck. I could hear a band warming up inside the inner bar. Three stars because the service was quick and the food was good. Detractors being the crowds at 12 o'clock and the nondescript signs. The free music was a plus, just this place wasn't what I expected at lunch time with everyone drinking and nobody eating. As others have stated this is more of a roadhouse or honkey tonk with modern music. Keep in mind there is a charge in the evening when it ramps thinks up to a more club atmosphere.

name: joseph dubose
text: This place is a timeless classic. Great music, friendly people, and a huge selection of goods at the gift shop. Parking is a bit tight and this place gets crowded quick but it is open from 0900 to 0230 so there is plenty of time to go and visit, relax, enjoy a cold beverage, and pick up some cool swag.

name: The Ellis Edge Team
text: Cool place, but between the cover charge and the $12 drinks it is to rich for my blood. It is, however, a once in a lifetime must see. I compare it to a giant, grown man's tree house. It's 3 stories high made of all plywood and 2x4's right on the gulf of Mexico! They have a fantastic singer and songwriter festival that makes it worth every penny if you can catch that! Fred, Steven, and Josh were our bartenders and they definitely get five stars!

name: Robert Barnes
text: Great outdoor patio atmosphere (with live music on the day I was there). However, food is way overpriced for  the quality and portion size you receive. Expect to pay near $20 for a "basket" of fried shrimp/fries. Shrimp was very salty. Fried fish and hushpuppies were overcooked. Maybe the grilled items are better, I don't know. I would come here for maybe a few drinks and an appetizer and listen to music, but not to spend $100 for dinner for a family of four.

I got the sampler and loved them all.
We were there for Bingo.
Sam was very funny and kept the game exciting.
We will be back and will recommend.

text: First time there. Great place. I love the old Florida casual feel. Bar staff was very nice. The entertainment was amazing. I'm making a note to come back same time next year for the songwriters festival. Amazing talent.

text: Awesome place to people watch and listen to live music located on the beach great staff Stefanie was my bartender she did an awesome job was very helpful to all customers thanks can't wait to get back

text: Country spot. Didn't have a diverse selection of music. Drinks were slow. Crowd was mixed. Lots of old folk lots of young folk but they were all white folk .... which is not a bad thing I just prefer a more mixed crowd.

name: Calvin Johnson
text: The yacht club has great fish. Beach your boat and sit in their bay side furniture.  The main building on the south side of the road is great. We were there Christmas day and their guests had brought food. A donation jar sitting there with a note reading 3.00 would be sufficient. I have never seen that before. What a great place. I was here 15 years ago and have talked about it plenty. They know how to reach out to good people. I will be back.

name: Vickie Smith
text: Sits on sugar beach with nice views, wander thru varying type music venues and bars.  There was no cover fee when I was there.  Music venues varied from old country to modern day rock with live musicians.  Just sit drink or dance.  Across the street is great seafood restaurant.

name: Deborah Selhost
text: We had the best time on Wen. Afternoon and came back at 2pm to see Bat again.He is a great entertainer and you talk about a guitar player...wonderful,loved his stories that went along with the trip back to the 60's and 70's.We were there on Wen. And Sat.Florabama is the best.

name: #NaLa Alabise
text: Stopped in at 2pm to have a snack and get some good pics. We ordered BBQ rolls and fries. Gage who took our order was super nice and accommodating. Robbie made our rolls and they were scrumptious! Definitely go to The FloraBama if you haven't already. Nice during the day with live music 365 days a year. Night time it turns into a club, which was also a lot of fun. Say hi to Gage & Robbie downstairs first tho. They are awesome! Thanks!

name: Jessica Geren
text: Everyone has to go at least once. I enjoy it more in the off season. I have a great time, no matter when I go

name: Nykkeisha Jumper
text: Didn’t care for music choice

name: JG Bigfish
text:
Its very nice. But just not the same. It used to be a shack.
It was The Place to be in the 70s and 80s.
Pro football players, TV and movie stars and anything you wanted, fresh off the boat.
The pictures and autographs long washed away.
"Save The Bails" shirts a thing of the past. I sketched that on a napkin in the 70s! And gaffed my share of Square Grouper! (Statute of Limitations is long passed)
Still have the Mullet Toss tho!
I'm just old, and nostalgic.
It's a great place with a fantastic history.
A Must Go for anyone in the neighborhood. Who knows who you may meet. And guaranteed fun.
The last picture I was in there got an NFL QB fired.
So be discreet! And ask some old guys. The stories are amazing!
See you around Thanksgiving!

name: r j
text: I rarely give a critical review, however, back in the late '90s our family reunion included a night here. Asked to leave with no explanation. Not the family; just me. Believe me, the fam. would have told me in excruciating detail if my behavior was out of line.

name: Sharon Troupe
text: The best Thanksgiving buffet ever .   Free dinner if you bring covered dish.  This is now our go to place for Thanksgiving

name: Shannon Warner
text: Great atmosphere great food. Manager very nice man. Waitress was lacking.

name: Dianne Christy
text: Always one of my beach favorites for bushwackers and music

name: Melissa Vanderhoof
text: Great place to go for live music!

name: Adam Schyvinck
text:
Nice little joint(to say the least)... this is the 3rd year that my family has come to Orange Beach, Al... the 1st year, I stopped out once. Last year I stopped by twice. This year I've been there 4 times(twice today)... But what really blew my mind, was that a couple workers remembered me(Cindy and Country)... Country even remembered my name after 4 days... top notch if you ask me... not to mention the killer bands

I might have to book a longer vacation next year

name: Van Sutphen
text:
GREATEST BEACH BAR! indoor or out , live music, great food (try all the types of oysters).
Happy hour till 6!

resp.text: We're so happy to hear ya'll had a great time! And we agree, ya gotta try all the oysters... they're the best! Hope to see ya'll back again soon :)

name: JUDI RHOADES
text: I was there on the day of 2 major events. (Mullet toss and Kenny Chesney) Parking was expensive. (paid $30 for 1/2 mile away closer parking was $70-$80). The place was packed. Waited in line about 30 minutes to get in. Cover charge was reasonable $10.(prices vary on time and your age). I will say the drinks were fantastic as were the bartenders. The souvenir store was packed as well. Prices were typical for the area. I would like to go again, just not during such a busy time.

resp.text: Hey Judi! Thanks for taking time to let us know about your recent visit. We're so glad you were here with us on such a a great weekend for Mullet Toss and Kenny Chesney making a surprise visit! We do apologize for your parking troubles, but those who charge for parking in the areas near the Flora-Bama are not affiliated with our business in any way as parking here on Flora-Bama  premises is free during Mullet Toss and all year long. Admission lines are always longer during Mullet Toss and our other special events, but we do hope you'll come back to see us again soon for a smoother experience :)

name: john carlasare
text: Best bar to have a great time.  Don’t forget to have a buschwacker or 2.  Songwriters festival was awesome as usually.

name: yvonne hawes
text: Cool place to visit. Great atmosphere, friendly staff!

name: C Ryan
text: Well this place is awesome. An adult beverage playground right on the beach.

name: Caly Czarnecki

resp.text: Thanks for letting us know about your recent visit, we're so glad you all enjoyed your time with us!

name: Tiffany Kidd

Not a lot of parking so finding a spot can be a bit of a challenge. Nice beach front area to visit while here. Look forward to visiting again.

text: One of Foley AL best kept secret. Outstanding food and service the Homemade marinara sauce is to kill for.

name: Mr. Mark Francis
text: Over rated bar. Awesome location to have a bar.

name: Ryan C
text:
Where to start??? Flora-Bama is a treasure-trove cacophony of wild to mild, country to classy, and even a spot to find a little religion if needed.

You will find a selection of different areas to hang out in all spread out in a seemingly maze like structure of decks and dancefloors. Sit in the open air overlooking the beach, or kick your heels up on the dancefloor. Need a midnight snack? Or a Tshirt to prove it? They have that too.

Don't feel like you're too old, too rich, too poor, too classy, or that this is just a country music bar. You will have a great time no matter who you are.

Ps. Don't for get to come on a Sunday morning and catch a seaside service. Perhaps with a mimosa...?

name: Pat Bachand
text: Had a great afternoon with Neil Dover. Great staff

name: Deb
text:
Had a great time at the Snowbird Hootenanny today, Flora-Bama put on a good meal, and we listened to some awesome tunes; really unique space, right on the beach!

P.S. the Bushwacker drink is really good!

name: Jose Chaparro
text:
Decorated nice. I enjoyed that part. The food left much to be desired. Especially for the price. Steak came to my table “rare” and bleeding. Sent it back and they put it on the grill again to cook. The grill must have been too hot because it did nothing to the center but charred the entire exterior.

I came from Chicago and was told by a colleague to try their shrimp and oysters. Their shrimp came way too salty and seemed to have no other seasoning. They also ran out of oysters which by itself isn’t a big deal.. but coupled with everything else, just added to the frustration. Waitress was polite. Ate there on 9-17-2018 @ 7 pm.

text: Fun place, live music, variety of bars and drinks

name: Aubrey Bozarth

name: deana mueller

name: Dave V
text: This place is awesome - great people watching, music, and cold beer and bushwhackers. Folks of all ages enjoy the Florabama. We make it a point to come by every beach trip and have introduced several friends who continue to visit.  Polar Bear Plunge on New Years Day is a great time !

name: Matt Voss
text: Awesome!  Everything you’d expect from a “roadhouse”...plenty of drinks, great food & excellent live music!  All of this & its ~100 yards from the ocean!

name: Jonathan Pitts
text: It's off season so I wasn't impressed but it's a cool place , nice atmosphere

name: Carrie L White

text: Got there at around 4pm on a Saturday it was packed already, but had a very fun vibe. Loved walking around and watching the different bands. Ordered a bushwacker and it was very strong but pretty good, we stayed and watched the big earl show. And he was hilarious! Just a good fun bar overall! Come before 6 to miss a cover charge of $5.

We were here during the Frank Brown  International Songwriters Festival.  I can't wait until we'r can come down again.

name: Scott Thompson
text: Always a great time, and Freddy was on point!

name: Tim K
text: We were not there for very long but had a very good time. Very laid-back easy-going very fun atmosphere. The bartender was very nice. There are a lot of things to do to include live music a big chair to sit in and those cut out things to take your photos in. And you can walk to the beach. Unfortunately the bar no longer straddles the Alabama Florida Line however the bar is in Florida and is right next to the Alabama state line. Highly recommend.

name: Sierota Beth Brackett
text: Halloween costume party was awesome! The event director (Amy) is incredible...thanks for choosing me as a judge, I really enjoyed it. This bar is huge...it has multiple floors and several rooms, all with a stocked bar of their own. The staff is friendly & courteous. It's the classic party place in this area....with mixture of locals & tourists alike. If you haven't experienced Flora-Bama yet, it's time to do so!!!

name: Kait Pezold
text: We ate at the Flora-Bama Yacht Club after a local told us it was the best one.3 out of our 5 meals were cold. The service was very slow and poor. The waitress was kind enough to take 25% off of our bill.

name: Scott
text: Great place to get a drink and listen to some really outstanding live music.  They let you write on the walls and tables with sharpies and hang your bras above the main stage.  I don’t wear a bra, but it was interesting.  The drink prices were reasonable and we had a great time.  If you are looking for a fun night, this would be a fantastic place to visit.

name: Mary Hurst
text:
I thought this place look interesting, so we tried it. They were short staffed that day due to a wreck blocking the main road there. Ok np, the manager was very nice.
We didn't stay for the food so I can't judge that. But, I was upset about the price of drinks and the small cup they used. .

name: Joshua Pirtle
text: Beautiful place and location. Great service with reasonable prices. Almost always some type of live entertainment. A must for visitors and locals.

name: Karen
text: Great iconic bar on the beach in Alabama.  And Florida.  Apparently it straddles the state line.  It's old and has a storied history that goes on and on.  Survived numerous storms and hurricanes, famous musicians stopping to play, customers of ALL kinds.  Went there as a snowbird and enjoyed some great afternoon live entertainment.  Drinks and beer were inexpensive and there were lots of friendly people here. Inside bars, outside bars, decks, patios...whatever floats your boat for a bar experience. They also had BINGO games on certain days which I did not attend.  This is not a fancy cocktail lounge or fine restaurant.  You order your food at a window and pick it up and carry it to wherever you want to sit.  Sunday morning's Worship on the Water was actually in a large tent (same tent they use for BINGO) and was a nice experience with a great band playing Christian songs.  If you get to Highway 182 and are in the vicinity of the AL/FL state line, I suggest at least stopping for a short time to check out the memorabilia and admire the stability of this longstanding roadhouse.

name: Stacy Sturmer
text: I was disappointed. As I realize the need for security. The man who checked my bag was very over baring. I felt violated. I wont be back.

name: Kevin Burrows
text: No trip to Orange Beach is complete without a stop in at Flora-Bama for a Bushwacker. Never disappointing, always cold and delicious. Create beachy atmosphere. Floribama is on both sides of the road. Beachside and Bayside

name: Keith Martin
text: Always a great experience the memories of this place goes back many years. Had many drinks over the years. Absolutely a must visit

name: Fred Wiles
text: Fun place and friendly staff! Definitely worth visiting!

name: Boyd Stuckey
text: Love this place

name: Steven Bradley
text:
Ran the Shark Run, and the start & finish was Flora-bama.

Fun spot on the beach, and back-cove, and on the state line!

It's one of those "tacky on purpose" places, and we had a lot of fun. Would definitely go back.

name: Chris Patrick
text: Pretty cool place!  My youngest had never been to Florida, but now he can say that he has!  Food was good and the employees were nice!!

name: Sandy Rosson
text: Loved it nice

name: Ivy Dwyer-Frazee
text: Fun place.

name: Loren Hanson
text: Noisy and tacky.  Nice combination for Beal Street but Snow Birds are desperate on the shore so it works.

name: Its Me Me
text: Very good, generally friendly atmosphere, good food, and view of the water, sound of the gulls, and the waves. Most of the time the staff is great, but sometimes not.

name: Taylor Ewing
text: Fish and Scott are the BEAT BARTENDERS AROUND! Super sweet guys who work quick but still have the time to chat. Give them a visit at the downstairs bar by the beach!

name: cbs331cbs
text: The coolest and craziest bar I've ever been to awesome time and people

name: Kim Bullock
text: We love it ! Good music, good food (baked oysters), and drinks

name: Obtaining Greatness [Walkers For Christ]
text: It was one of the most lively bars ive been too. It was a memorable experience that I share with my friends. Great setup as well

name: Robett Robinson
text: Always bring visitors here, a good time watching the shows and the people

name: Curt Brewer
text: Flora-Bama is one of the coolest places ever. In fact, it is my favorite place in the world to vacation. There's always great live music here. People are always friendly and do all they can to help you. Frank Brown International Songwriters Festival is definitely something you don't want to miss. They've been doing it for over 30 years. It happens every November. People who wrote the biggest songs in the world come every year to this Festival.

resp.text: Thanks Curt ;)

name: TRIPLE DIAMOND PAWN
text: Loved the Justin Wilson Products there.

name: Shannon Madill
text: Great music ,bushwackers ,and bartenders but one of the security guys was extremely rude to me when I got pushed into him by some drunk guy and he wanted to get an attitude for something out of my control and tried to say I had been over served and asked me to leave until a random witness explained and he still never apologized even though I'd apologized immediately and tried to explain. Bottom line if you are a country guy who wants to get super trashed and get away with whatever this is the place for you. Love the music scene and bars but not to keen on the people this place attracts.

name: Geoff HockeyDad
text: Always a good time!  Great service from Chris at the downstairs bar, and always great to see Country running around taking care of customers and situations!  Great live music! It's the Flora-Bama, what else needs to be said?!!!!

name: Greggory Justice
text: Waited over an hour for food at the grill then when it came it wasn't even that good. Was told they had a big party of people and it put them behind on orders. They should have enough staff to accommodate any size along with other customers.

resp.text: Hi TJ - Thanks for letting us know about your recent visit with us. On behalf of the Flora-Bama, I'd like to apologize for the inconvenience you all experienced. May I ask, did this occur at the Flora-Bama or possibly at one of our restaurants across the street, Ole River Grill or the Yacht Club? Please know your comments have been passed to upper management for further review and action, and any other info you may have would be helpful so that we can address this with the appropriate staff. Again, we do apologize this occurred and we hope to hear back from you. Please feel free to send any comments to blakeli@florabama.com.

name: nstur65
text: Awesome!

name: Sarah Bailey
text: Tasty frozen drinks, try the Pinky Swirl!!  Great friendly service. We enjoyed our visit and Pinky just made it better

name: Dave Sparks
text: Great experience,  cool old Roadhouse,  great service,  highly recommend,  great scenery,  will go back,  good times,  thank you

name: L T

name: r anthony richardson

name: Kimberly Heigert

name: Heather Reed

name: Dunamis Films
text: Very rude employees

resp.text: We are so sorry to hear that our staff wasn't friendly. We do hope that you will come back to see us so we can show you a good time. I would love some more feedback to be able to address it with the appropriate staff members. Please email me at jenifer@florabama.com with some more details.

name: Angela Brunson
text: You MUST get their BBQ egg roll. It was amazing! I'm a Memphis girl, and they did their BBQ right! And it's only $3. The burger was really great too. The restaurant is rustic and basically a walk-up beach bar, but I was happy to enjoy their food on the deck while watching the waves.

name: Jill Messerly
text: Great music

name: Kathleen Hamsen

name: Rapheal King

name: Tim Byrd

name: Jakki XxX
text: Came from Orlando after watching this place on the food channel, for their bacon & cheese covered oysters. They were alright nothing to write home about, the food just wasn't that good. The place was dead and it was spring break, I don't think I'd come back to this place again.

name: Jeff Anderson
text: Super atmosphere, just like remembered from back in 1998!

name: Caleb Gibson

name: K C

name: Joe Herd

name: Lenny Michaela
text: A legendary bar that you have just got to see to believe. Multiple bars and bands on different levels in this drunken maze of wood structures. They host church services on Sundays in an authentic laid back style. Even on weeknights during the summer, you will find 2-3 bands and 6+ bars rocking this place.

name: Cora Dees
text: We give it a Big 10... Awesome place

name: Debra Menasco
text: The entrance is the absolute worst thing on the  beach. Traffic stops for miles and no one seems to care except to get people in their doors. Orange Beach really needs to do something about this. Put in a pedestrian bridge. Spend a little of your money keeping your patrons safe.

resp.text:
Thank you for reaching out and for your concern. We apologize for any delays you incurred.

I can assure you that the safety of our customers and patrons is our main priority, and we actually did apply for a deputy to be on site at 11am. There have been some recent changes to the county and how we are to get deputies on property. It's a process where you submit requests for them, and our request for this weekend's day shifts didn't get picked up by a deputy. Also, the county will not allow us to man the crosswalk on our own. Yes, I know this sounds ridiculous, but it is true. We are very much actively working on this change in process and please know that safety is our number one concern.

Regarding the traffic, we have actively met with Alabama DOT and Florida DOT to get them in the room together to discuss our traffic/road issues, since we do not own the road and cannot fix it without their help. These meetings have been going on for a few years. Thankfully, there is progress being made and Alabama DOT has already completed their part of the road, including the addition of an added turning lane. Florida still has to do their part, and the crosswalk will have a light among other changes. We are waiting for Florida to implement their changes and will continue to make sure safety is our top priority for our customers.

name: Mark Early
text: Cool Bar and when it's not hosting special events it has multiple bars and stages for when an introvert needs to go recharge there batteries away from a packed room.

name: L Ford
text: Gave 3 stars because my husband enjoyed his sandwich. I ordered a $19 oyster basket and it came half oysters and half shrimp. I told our waiter and his comment was, "Well, did you appreciate it?" I should have asked him if he would appreciate it if I left him half cash and half monopoly money for a tip. No offer to reduce my bill or bring me additional oysters. Lunch was a bit too pricey but I guess you pay for the name and a water view. I wasn't impressed.

name: daniel simone
text: Great place to get food and drinks, reasonably priced. Great view and there is also church there on Sundays, they have 2 services as well for it. I always make a pit stop here when I come through this area. A must when you come through town for sure

name: Abby Gibbons
text: Great bar, and lots of fun for families or adults. There’s a very good variety of music and views throughout the bar. It’s an all around great environment and very safe. ****the management was extremely rude though, specifically a middle aged woman whose name I recall is Robin. I am 19 years old and was extremely respectful. I entered as 19 years old and got my wristband and marked as underage. Also paid $15 cover charge to enter. After about an hour and a half I got approached by security and told to leave. They thought I had taken a drink from someone’s alcoholic drink, when I in fact had not. I was cooperative but I immediately asked them to look at the cameras or breathalyze me. They refused to look at cameras but called a county police officer. Robin took me outside and the officer conducted a sobriety test and I passed. The police officer was extremely respectful and said my eyes were smooth and there was no problem but that they probably wouldn’t let me back in. Robin proceeded to tell me I was bad for the establishment and she was extremely accusatory. I was shocked by how she was treating me. I didn’t even know how to respond. The police officer then didn’t feel a breathalyzer was necessary even though I said I wanted to take one. I am extremely frustrated by how I was treated by the establishment in this incident. I had no chance at reentry even though I was being respectful and following the rules. I understand that it’s their job to protect their liquor license and they have to enforce the law. There is a much better way to carry out how they enforce rules though. Just because I am not of legal age to drink, doesn’t mean I do not deserve respect.

name: Trinity
text: Good food. Very rude servers.

resp.text: Hey there - thank you for taking time to let us know about your recent visit to the Flora-Bama. On behalf of our team, I sincerely apologize for the experience you all had with some of our staff. Please know your comments have been passed to upper management for further review and action, and any other info you may have (description on what they looked like) would be helpful so that we can assure this is addressed with the appropriate staff. We do hope to have you all back for a better experience again soon!

name: mark R
text: Gotta get Bushwhacked when you get here!

name: Brian Pritchard
text: We went here during the offseason on a dead weekend but they still had two live shows going on and we had a good time. Drinks were affordable and you can walk right out onto the beach. Great location, Good times.

name: Codi Jones
text: This bar looks like a dive with so much character. It's way bigger than you would think. Make sure to try the key lime daiquiri which is to die for. Dont suck it down too fast before walking on the beach because the brain freeze is a 5 star for sure. Who doesnt love a bar smack dab in the middle of Alabama and Florida with the ocean to boot?

name: Carol Traynor
text: Love this place! Music for everyone,great beach spot!A landmark for the community! If you have not been go now!

name: Ginger Vaughn
text: Tacky but that's what makes it popular. Great burgers.

name: Dominic Florio
text: Great music and above all great crowd!! Had a good time😜✌👍🍻🍺

name: andrew armstrong
text: Stupid setup all the way. You have a huge building, 1 line to get food, and no servers. The line wasn't moving very fast. Had may 12 people in front of us and didn't move an inch in 30 minutes so we went to florabama grill across the street. Awesome food there but had to get a servers attention.

resp.text: Hi Andrew - We appreciate the feedback from your recent visit with us. On behalf of the Flora-Bama I'd like to apologize for the inconvenience this caused you all, and please know your comments have been passed to upper management for further review and action. I'm not in the business of making excuses but it seems you may have caught us at a "not our best" moment. We do hope you all will give us another shot when back in the area, and again we appreciate you taking time to let us know about your experience.

name: Jim Stuckey
text: Beautiful! Nice place. Older clientele when I was there and I'm 50!

name: John Wright
text: An absolute must.  History meets the new generation.  Incredible live music venue with indoor bar areas to beach stages. Who can tell me about a tradition known as the Mullet Toss?

name: Thomas Gautney
text: Good Food, Music, Drinks, Fun atmosphere!

name: S E
text: The Flora-Bama lived up to its reputation during my visit. A great view, good music, and lively people made for a memorable experience.

name: Chris Solano
text: Flora-bama is a fun place to go and see, the only thing that is a pain is the parking.

name: Tanner Dale
text: Unless you pay $25 for vip they don’t care if you’re in line they will make you wait all night

name: shannon Graham
text: Had a great time .   Will be back on Sunday!!

name: David Helton
text: Awesome as always. Local and still love it. 35+ years, yep I'm an old man.

name: Kelly Samples
text: Always wanted to check out the Flora Bama. Finally got the chance to do that this time! We had a great time, even for a Wednesday.

name: Deann Moss
text: Very lively place to visit!  All kinds of music, bands, vocals.  Great views of the bay as well!

name: Tactical Mike
text: Awesome Venue, we sat and ate at the Grill ( Great Food) then went over to the lounge. we were just passing by to check it out as must see on our trip and we got a Private tour from "Country" , he took us around and gave us a history of the place.. Wonderful atmosphere and the "Bamily" connection is great!  A must see and take in even if passing through. We Will Return.

name: Angie Becker
text: Had a awsome time good food great service !!

name: Matthew Lancourt
text: We stopped in on a Tuesday night around 5:30 and ordered their taco special.  The food taste good, but wasn't that warm.  I'll cut them some slack as this seems like more of a music venue/bar.  We stayed for a few hours and listened to some live music and really enjoyed ourselves!  I would recommend checking this place out after dinner...

name: Richard Pepper
text: This place was pretty cool. There were multiple stages for live music which was nice. The place is definitely a bunch of afterthought additions pieced together to make a maze of party areas. The music was good and the drinks were reasonably priced. Parking could use some help, but local law enforcement kept the crowd and road crossing under control.

name: Allen Cully
text: Has to be experienced.  Good food,live music or wander to the beach.

name: Matt garrity
text: Great food. 3 areas to choose from , several live shows great atmosphere

name: Jeffrey Messer
text: Fun place, exactly what we expected. Good atmosphere, music, and cold beer. Headed back tonight.

name: Howard Weiss
text: Fun times

name: Colette Turpin
text: They do NOT have dueling pianos, even though when I called they said they do. There is a single piano player in a band there. Crowded and no where to sit. ☹️

name: LaDawna Roberts
text: I really enjoyed the church service. Always wanted to come

name: Misti Hardwick
text: Great bands. Friendly people. Great service. Cold drinks!

name: J B
text: So much fun! Staff was fun and on point. Bands were great! You just gotta go.3 bars to see.

name: Brenda Miller
text: Must see.  Great food. Wonderful staff.  Plenyy of space for fun

name: Chance Cooper
text: Lots of fun.  Many stages. Good entertainment.

name: John Payne
text: Fantastic bar. Here with my friends and loving the music. So many stages to choose from. Not sure about the food but plenty of choices for beer and liquor. So much fun.

name: KELLY J
text: Great place and great times!!

name: Waverly Marcum
text: Another fine Thanksgiving put on by  Flora bama great food great company great music everything was wonderful thank you  Flora bama

name: Paul Beach
text: Man what can I say. It’s a blast going in. It’s legendary

name: Anna Jenkins
text: We were told a 45-50 min wait. However and hour and 1/2 later we asked and they had forgotten about our party. Our waiter was so sweet and amazing but the bushwhacker was absolutely terrible and he did take it back but the hostess staff were not very nice at all and the food was so so.

name: Doug Mills
text: Awesome place to go for anything from cocktails to music of all kinds and even an excellent church service on Sunday mornings. A must see for all our friends who visit.

name: Chuck Bossom
text: Always a good time.

name: Mark Cheairs
text: Fun

name: Mary Simmons
text: Fun experience with many areas to be explored! Indoor/outdoor seating. Live music! Fish tacos were great!!!

name: Tammi Kiser
text: Fun place

name: BOB KIBBEY
text: Don't waste time with Wednesday senior Luncheon. Most bring chips or crackers as passing dish. Can not hear band to much chatter by old timers. Nice and unique place just stay away from Wednesday luncheon.

name: alan jacobs
text: Very nice place ,I met up with a friend I haven't seen in 25 years was a great place to talk and have a drink and catch up.

name: David Eastes
text: There is a lot of evidence to indicate that heavy drinking takes place here at night. Definitely a party bar. We loved it.

name: Lisa Pickens
text: I want to give a great big shout out for employee Country. He was busy putting out food on the buffet and I interrupted his task by asking him questions about the New Years Eve bash. He was very helpful and even helped us find a seat. Kudos for the helpfulness and kindness.

resp.text: Country is an amazing employee. I am so glad you had a chance to interact with him. Come back and see us again soon :)

name: Travis Smith
text: Always packed we tried there Easter Egg hunt for the kids this year and it was to packed for the small amount of eggs in each age group. The best part was seeing the bunny sky dive onto the beach but not worth the hassle fighting that crowd

resp.text: Thanks for letting us know about your recent visit for our Easter Egg Hunt. Please know your comments have been passed to upper management for further review and action. We do plan to extend all age groups quite a bit for our upcoming ears, so please come back and join us next year!

name: Leonard Koch
text: Fantastic as always

name: Bob Lindstedt
text: Great, eclectic atmosphere. Bushwhackers are great!

name: Jeffrey Morales
text: Favorite place in Gulf Shores. Best to drink outside near beach. Bar car get overcrowded.

name: Andrew Stiteler
text: All fried food. Oyster choices were strange. I liked the oysters in New Orleans way better. A bit trashy for me at this place. Just my opinion but if you come here you should catch my drift.

name: marcy sanders
text: Service was bad, food was blah, hot in the building. Will not go back- don't get why it's so popular.

name: Nelson Gingerich
text: Love it

name: L R
text: Music was great. Best bushwhacker in the area

name: Ryan and Susan Short
text: Great entertainment with three stages and lots of bars.  Hard to go wrong!  And the Bushwackers are wonderful.

name: Lisa Rexroat
text: Pretty cool looking place. Drinks were decent. I enjoyed the band we watched. The bras hanging was pretty amusing.

name: Jay Flack
text: Great live music venue,Honky Tonk Roadhouse...

name: Brent Hansen
text: Went to church at a bar.  That was a first for me.  They say, it's okay to not be okay.  Great saying.  Come as you are.  God wants to know each of his creations, no matter what.

resp.text: Thanks so much for letting us know about your recent visit! We're so happy to hear you all had a great time!  Hope to see ya back here On The Line again soon :)

name: Jen Heider
text: This iconic bar sits basically on the Florida Alabama state line right on the Gulf of Mexico. It has multiple levels with indoor outdoor areas. There are multiple bars with plenty of seating and standing room. Each bar area has different bands or some form of live music most days, pool tables, dance floors and there are bras hanging from the ceiling etc. This is not anything upscale or well maintained. Nobody goes there for that, and if that's what you want go elsewhere. This place is for dancing, visiting with friends and maybe making some new ones! You will find Bama to be a melting pot... full of college crowds to the old folks, surfers, bikers, yachtees and everyone in between. It is an experience worth having at least once!

name: Honney Peterson
text: This place is so much fun!!! Relaxed atmosphere, music, dance floors and plenty of fun people!!! Go visit and have yourself a great time!!!

name: Blake Davis
text: 4th time grabbing signature drinks on the Gulf Shore. A must see.

name: Lynn Kloss
text: Totally unique place right on the Florida  / Alabama state line, hence the name.  They have live music everyday.  We went for the not so typical Bingo.  It's a making fun of Bingo, so if your a dire hard player, this is not for you.  We had a great time.  Its free Mon, Tues, Thurs and Friday from 2-4pm.  You have to do it at least once.  You can leave anytime you want and come in the middle.  They even have Sunday Mass at the FloraBama.

name: Ted Ferretti
text: This place has lots of history. But it's still a tourist spot with high prices. Mixed drinks are surprisingly small in quantity and size.

name: Joseph Regan
text: They said that it would be an hour wait but it ended up being 2 and 30 minutes and yet we still didn’t get are table so we left

name: Mela Bella ('Mela)
text: Fun, I enjoy the staff

name: Jeannie Woodall
text: What's not to love if you're looking for a casual beach vibe and good music!

name: brenda cowell
text: Dump

resp.text: Hey Brenda! I'm sorry that you did not enjoy your time here at the Flora-Bama! Could you email more information to mary@florabama.com? We'd love to hear more and hopefully have you back soon!

name: Marlo Deguzman
text: Live music was great! Bushwachers are amazing! I tried them elsewhere but it does not compare. Had a great time!!

name: Michael Vickery
text: Best time had listening to those who write the songs for the ones who sing them.

name: Sue McAlexander
text: Ppffft. Drinks are strong, but the food is meh.

name: Bill Doering
text: Fun place on the border of Florida and Alabama.

name: Maggie Bell
text: If you’re not sure where to go in the Gulf Shores area just go to Flora-Bama. There’s a stage for whatever your taste in music may be. Flora-Bama is sure to be a good time. Be sure to get a bushwhacker while you’re there.

resp.text: So glad you had a large time!! Hope to see ya back again soon :)

name: allthatandsmore33
text: Amazing place to get your lotto tickets and they even had samples of liquor.

name: Designs Inspired by You
text: Always have the best time at Florabama, year after year. They even stored our luggage until we had to leave, when our condo or any other hotel wouldn't. They go above and beyond!

name: Ralph Knese, III
text: Good food, good music,  great atmosphere!

name: Eric Anderson
text: Whats not to like?! The beer and bushwhackers are fantastic, as are prices and the bartender, Mike, is the BEST!

name: Annej Elder
text: What a marvelous Venue close to Orange Beach, AL! 4 live bands...much fun!

name: Scott Struecker
text: Really great place to see And drink and hang out

name: Jeanna Long
text: Awesome! Love it!

name: Mark R
text: Good place for food and drinks.....very historical been there before I was a kid and still going great atmosphere and beach views as well as summer time views

name: Corey McCree
text: Awesome place!  live music 365 days a year

name: Tommy O'Brien
text: An amazing bar for any kind of person! They have any kind of live music playing, great drinks and an amazing experience. They offer fun for the whole family!!

name: Scott Wiltberger
text: Awesome experience, awesome environment. Have a Bushwacker and a dozen Raw on the half shell or peel and eat shrimp, all very good! Look forward to visiting every year. A must visit!!

name: Chad Wilcox

name: Lyndsey Taylor

name: Cj Meyers

name: john smith
text: Fun sprawling bar, friendly folks and a VERY politically incorrect band. Very strong, reasonably priced drinks. What more do you need?

name: Alan Strope
text: What a great place.  Favorite guys there are Country and Jerr.  They were super helpful, nice, and fun to talk with.  Loved Big Earl and the Sexual Biscuits.  Dueling pianos guys apologized after I called them out for writing a racial slur regarding religion but otherwise they were great.  2nd time here and will surely be back!!

name: Kita Welch
text: Great place, great time, we love our Pinky bartender and her signature drink, the Pinky Swirl!

name: Stuart Smith
text: So much fun and more live music in one place than I've ever seen. The food is great too!

name: TONYA Medina
text: Nice folks. Love the scratch offs and lotto side. The back bars smell like Bourbon Street. Use some bleach on the floors guys

name: Matt Sloan
text: Good food and nice environment for the kids before 6

name: ShadowTiger 3
text: Bar was great live music was great .  Family fun all the way around.

name: Bob Gean
text: Great atmosphere and a whole lot of fun

name: Don Hansen
text: Unbelievable

name: Jackie Dills
text: Good night, was entertained by a very good band, Ryan Dyer duo. Waitress kept our drinks coming, very friendly people. Got to celebrate in a birthday (happy birthday again Stephen from Houston). Just a good night all around for me, my wife and our friends. You guys make it hard to leave before closing, we will be back.

resp.text: So glad you all had a great time! Hope to see you back here on the line soon :)

name: M P
text: Always a great time at the Bama.

name: Lisa Sampair
text: Went to the one not on the beach side.  Had a waitress  and better food options.  Love the Shrimp appetizer.

name: Ron Quilhot

name: Julie Strickland

name: Lynda Michael

name: Rebecca

name: Jeff Sanders

name: Jana Oxenrider

name: James Glaze

name: Paul Swanson
text:
The legend does exist!!!!
It is real!!!!
Everyone there is simply amazing!!
Cindy is absolutely awesome so is everyone there
The one and only Flora-Bama.
Never been?
You simply haven't lived then.
Go!
Go there NOW!!!!!!!!

resp.text: Thanks for lettings know about your recent visit, so glad you had a great time!

name: Mike Hamann
text: So many different places to go, a few different live music spots. Only bad thing is it is very hot inside the main hall, such a good time though if you like people and music

name: Kathy Silance
text: Good music, food, sunsets and atmosphere!!  Our service was super quick and we had a great time!

name: David Stover
text: Having a great time. Just a small acoustic set but a fun band. Great drinks and fair prices.

name: Debbie Wilson
text: Spent first 16 yrs of my life playing on those beautiful sugar sand beaches and georeous multicolored coastal waters along gulf shores, Orange Beach to name couple and I am so thankful for my childhood and what I refer to as God's little paradise and his sweet gift to us Baldwin county folk on into Florida and  I'm very proud to call this my home again!!!

name: Sophie Markham
text: This place is amazing! They have great live music and free bingo every weekday from 1-4 with great prizes for all ages! This is a welcoming place during the day for all ages and at night it is a great hangout and dancing place for the fun adults! I definitely reccomend coming here and it is so worth it! Also they have great food and drink choices!

name: Kimberly OGrady
text: Landed on the beach 2X in last week Thanks to Slim and Lee and the whole crew at Skydive the Gulf

name: Miranda Barron
text: Had a great time at this establishment. It was a different experience but i loved hearing the live bands playing at different levels of the bar. It was pretty neat and i enjoyed partying with people we didn't even know. Everyone was very friendly and the drinks were good. Will definitely return!

name: Mike tatham
text: Great raw oysters, great service, great time. From the moment we walked in the door the hostess sat us, and before we could even look at the menus, the waitress took our drink orders. Really an amazing experience. Will defiantly be back.  Very easy menu and kid friendly. Can’t wait to go back. Price is average for what you get.

name: Douglas Dyle
text: Always fun but tonight's band just average.

name: Stephanie W.
text: Good time had by all. Just wish they wouldn’t allow smoking inside.

name: Elizabeth Goodwin
text: Ate at lounge on ground level behind Grill. Food & service was good. Raw oysters perfect. Live music. Across the street multiple bands, good food & drinks.

name: Bruce Stocker
text: Way too much fun! Music variety and drinks are fantastic!

name: Suzanne Allen
text: Always fun to have lunch here just for the ambience and fun memories all over the place. If you’re a country fan, Kenny Chesney and others have written songs of this iconic place. I’d love to be here for the interstate mullet toss - Florida to Alabama😎

name: Laurie Horak
text: The drinks are good and the staff is great but don’t eat there. You can do better at any fast food restaurant.

resp.text: HI Laurie - Thanks for letting us know about your recent visit. Can you tell us what it was you ordered that you weren't satisfied with? Please know your comments have been passed to upper management for further review and action. Hope to see ya'll back again soon!

name: Debbie Manning
text: Such fun! Perdido Brothers were so good!

name: Kitty Wigginton
text: It was the best beach  gathering  had in a long time - "good time"

name: Mike Austin
text: Very cool place to see. Food was okay not great

name: Cindy Patton
text: It's a beach bar. Pretty basic. Lots of bars to stand in line at but it moved rather quickly. The key lime pie frozen drink was yummy!

name: Ryan Fuqua
text: I enjoyed the food. The beer variety was quite substantial, but beware of getting a domestic. It comes in a smaller cup than the others. My fish was done perfectly. Shrimp tasted very good as well. If you sit at the tables, invest in some wooden shims to level up the tables. They wobbled more than an out of balance tire. This did make it easy to share food as it slid to the other side of the table with the smallest shift in beer volume.

name: Scott Eddins
text: It's a very good place to meet people and hangout and have fun and some drinks

name: Erika
text: If you have never been it is a must DO. All ages in this establishment. Food is great

name: Kathy Ryals
text: Great way to spend their afternoon

name: Missy MacGown
text: If you've never been there then you gotta go see it. Such a cool place with so many signatures all over the walls, tables, duct work. You name it. The oldest one I saw was from 1973. Very good food, great staff.

name: Glinda Mantle
text: It's just the coolest place ever built!

name: Jeffrey
text: If you're anywhere in the area you got to go to Flora-Bama, somewhere sometime time someone will ask you if you went. You'll look silly if you don't.

name: Tabitha Mckown
text: Worse food I’ve ever had at the gulf.  First and last time

resp.text: Hey there - Thanks for taking time to let us know about your recent visit with us. I see you weren't happy with your food order, can you tell us what it was you had? Please know your comments have been passed to upper management for further review and action, so any other info you may have would be helpful so that we can assure this is addressed with the appropriate departments. We do hope to have you all back for a better experience and thank you again for letting us know your concerns.

name: Lutz Walters

name: Barbara Davidson
text: Good place to stop in if you want to have a drink

name: Rebecca Glover
text: Expect long wait time , Over an hour. Restaurant was family friendly. Food was very good .

resp.text:
Hi There,
Thanks for taking time to let us know about your rent visit. Can you tell us if you meant to leave this review on one of our other properties, the Flora- Bama Ole River Grill or Flora-Bama Yacht Club? It just sounded like this may have been meant for one of those establishments and we'd like to get this to the correct team so that that may address this issues as soon as possible. Thanks so much and looking forward to hearing back.

name: Dave Tastic
text: You gotta stop by if you are close enough. Great live music

Yes, a Kenny Chesney hangout! Come & see for yourself what you have been missing!
I was country when country wasn't cool & I've been an aircraft mechanic while you were still in school!

Shrimp tasted very good as well. If you sit at the tables, invest in some wooden shims to level up the tables. They wobbled more than an out of balance tire. This did make it easy to share food as it slid to the other side of the table with the smallest shift in beer volume.
