text: Last Night here. Having a good time.

name: K & B
text: Lots of bars. Lots of music. Just a good time to be had by all.

name: Sally Geurts
text: Awesome service today from Sara.  She was super friendly and recommended the best shrimp on the appetizers ever.   The menu says it is spicy but it really isn't.   It is just delicious.   My husband and I booth loved it.

resp.text: Yum! Thanks for visiting Sally! Hope to see you again soon.

name: Dawn Sunshine
text: Bingo was a blast. So glad we stumbled in at that time. Drinks were good. Location is ideal for fun!

name: Christopher Fowler
text: Didn't expect to have such an amazing time. My friends took me out for the evening, and I got hooked on the bushwhackers and one of the most entertaining funk/R&B bands I've seen. The lead singer (looked like Steve Harvey) had the place jumpin. Will definitely be back for the drinks and entertainment.

name: John Baugher
text: Good atmosphere , cold beer and exceptional Oysters !

name: Jesslyn Wright
text: Great food and friendly people. Loved it!

name: Angela Stephenson
text: We've had thanksgiving lunch here believe it or not! Everybody brings a covered dish. Pretty crowded, but good fellowship. We stopped in for t-shirts this trip, but the bar scene is very crowded and there's a cover charge, so we didn't fool with it. Wanted something with a low key envt.

resp.text: We are so glad you stopped in Angela, you will have to come again during the day when it is more relaxed! Thank you for the review :)

name: George Russell
text: Awesome.  Can't say enough.  Best Bushwackers in ALABAMA.  Great food and excellent bands.

name: Amanda Sanders
text: Love, love Flora-Bama

name: Jax Foux
text: Great place and wonderful people

name: Melissa Kadorian Azarva
text: Really cool bar right on the Florida Alabama state line! This place is huge!

name: Steve Helderman
text: Great atmosphere and plenty of music

name: robin gonzales
text: I had a wonderful time

name: Vivian Vaughn
text: Great place too go with friends

name: tim vanmatre
text: Celebrating our engagement

name: Pamela Prather
text: Always fun with good bands and even better Bushwackers.

name: Turpin Ashurst
text: 2 church services, 9 and 11. Hundreds of people attend weekly. Excellent preacher.

resp.text: Hey there! Thanks for letting us know about your recent visit, we're glad you had a great time at our Sunday Services with Worship on the Water. Pastor Dan is AWESOME!! Hope to see ya back again soon :)

name: Nancy Lepera
text: So much fun, girls trip, fabulous place.

name: Stan Smith
text: Pretty cool place with 3 stages and live music all night, food was good too.  Crowded in some places but lots of room to roam around with several varieties of local and well known artist.

name: Harry Johnson
text:
pretty cool place, you have to go in through the gift shop. lol. Cop car sitting outside with the lights running given, every night.  no big deal though keep your nose clean and you won't have a problem.
5 stars goes to having TITO'S on tap, is that not COOL #titovodka

name: Ken Nelson Jr
text: Fun place to go get Bush whacked.  Lol!

name: Preston Cook
text: Great fun but drinks are pricey.

name: Ryan Pittman
text: Cover charge a little steep for 18 year olds, plus I couldn't find a bra in my size 😏😁

name: Randy Reeves
text: Gotta stop in every time we pass by. We went to the Kenny Chesney concert there and every time we go it brings back fond memories!

name: Pilar Vetsch
text: We always had fun at this place

name: Patty Parker
text: I liked what I saw it was during the day took my 13 year old had access to the beach

name: Alyssa
text: The food here is excellent and the servers are very attentive. We came here during our last trip and knew that we would need to come back during our next trip.

resp.text: Thanks for letting us know about your recent visit, we're so happy you all enjoyed everything! Hope to see you back again soon!

name: Michael Ward
text: Fun atmosphere. Great place to party! Sunday church services there are enjoyable, as well. Can pull right up on your boat too. Very convenient.

name: James Jones
text: It is very large Place much bigger than you would think from the outside but once we went inside there wasn't many people but that was due to being in an offseason but if you're down there and you have a chance you should go because it's a very interesting historical place kind of a gym of the location

name: Sydney Verant
text: If you're staying within a close drive if the flora-bama, definitely check it out. The grill is family friendly, but I dont reccomend the bar for kids. The staff was great and the menu was okay. I dont feel like there was anything particularly special about this restaurant/bar other than the affiliation with Kenny Chesney. So, if you're a kenny chesney buff, go to the bar, not the restaurant.

name: Diana Roberts
text: Love this place!!!!

name: Katherine Calloway
text: Unique place with lots to see and multiple bands playing. Good food and drinks! Beach is just across board walk and it's beautiful!!

name: danLP07
text: Great live music - very crowded! Made for a great atmosphere filled with festival-goers. Not sure yet if it's my scene so I'll have to visit again next year for a redo. ;)

name: Brittney Camp
text: To hot to just come and eat. Cool atmosphere though.

name: Ashleigh Sweet
text: Fun if you are looking for a more casual, fun setting. Always a ton of bachelorette and bachelor parties there. A very diverse crowd makes for great people watching. Always have at least 2 bands playing in one of their many bar areas.

name: Tucker Nebel
text: I love this place. There are so many places to go and explore. The food is really good. The wings are better than you'd expect and of course all of the seafood is really good.

resp.text: Thank you for your review! We look forward to seeing you on your next visit!

name: seekerfine
text: What a fun place...drinks a little pricey..entertainment outstanding

name: Ginny Lyon
text:
Stopped by Flora-Bama restaurants/bars to check it out. It's right on the Florida Alabama line, and that's how it got it's name.
They have 2 restaurants on one side or the street and another along with some bars on the other side of the road. They have live music and offer free bingo certain days during the week. You really need to try the bingo it's a hoot. Not your ordinary bingo, it's all free! There is a gift shop as well.
Flora-Bama is right on the beach and the view is spectacular. Check out the sunset, beautiful.
If your visiting the Gulf Shores of Alabama or the areas of Pensacola, Florida you need to stop by to see it, it's nothing fancy...just down home fun!

resp.text: Thanks for the awesome review, Ginny! So glad you had a large time and we hope to see you back soon!

name: Tom Taylor
text: Spent the afternoon there having drinks and listening to T-bone Montgomery.   Excellent music, great service, and cheap but good drinks.

name: David Crow
text: Great gift shop and service. Busy place on the beach and you can count on a solid Sunday preaching while enjoying a beverage. My first Bushwhacker experience -a delicious frosted drink that's not for the weary.

resp.text: We appreciate your review David and hope to see you again soon! :)

name: Jeanette Bricker
text: Smelled very strong of cigarettes.

name: Lacey Burnett
text: Always well taken care of here. Be patient with the staff when they are packed. They can't hear everyone at once. And also, but most importantly,  if you have time on your visit they hold Sunday service at 9& 11 great church.

name: SCOTT WOLSTENHOLME
text: Love this place ...home away from home...

name: Joanne Gibson
text: Always a fun place to be. For the mullet toss The trolley (from Winn Dixie perdido/Publix orange beach) is the way to go.

name: Brandon Flowers
text: 10 bars with 5 different bands playing, cold beer and great atmosphere would definitely revisit or reccomend to anyone

name: Jason Nitcholas
text: Awesome if you like country music,  not for me

name: Susan Yager
text: It's a fun place if you want to party like an animal.  It seems dirty and it can be smoky.  The church on Sunday, though, is awesome!

name: Renee Goertz
text: Always a blast. Every. Time

name: Samantha Crane
text: Amazing time at the beach, restraint and shops

name: Erskin Hickman
text: Great "tourist stop". Food is OK. A bit pricey.

name: Sandi Neering
text: I cannot say enough about this place. By far THE best place for the best music ever.  Sraff is wonderful, security if great, the music entertainment is out of this world ..thank you Joe Gilchrist!

name: Yamaha 457
text: Beer was warm

name: Lissa Brooks
text: Three friends and I, all locals, just paid $5 a piece to get into this place. They spent 5 minutes analyzing one of their IDs because it was brand new with a different holo. We finally got let in, he makes a joke about it being like TSA and we all got kicked out immediately. We literally weren’t inside for a minute. I’m pretty sure it’s because he’s covered in tattoos but that’s cool. They’ll continue to let spring breakers in with molly and coke like the ones behind us so they can spend daddy’s money but not locals with face tattoos. Shouldn’t have gone in the first place, definitely not coming back.

name: Brian Keast
text: Stop here every time I'm on vacay down here. Love the atmosphere 😎

name: Doug Walker
text: One of our favorite places to go at the beach!  Lots of different musicians and styles so you can find what you like. If you haven't been, you should give it a try!

name: Sheila Steimel
text: Great music!! Love the atmosphere. Absolutely love you can hear the band on the beach!!

name: Aaron Osborne
text: Like their saying says, good times and good music

name: Linda Gosa
text: Good music, friendly staff and happy people.  The food is amazingly good for a beach hangout.  Never had a bad meal there.  "Not Your Mother's Bingo" is free from 1-4 from M-F and is lots of fun.

name: Jim Aicone
text: A Gulf Coast landmark that is worth the visit. Even if it's just to walk around and snap some photos. Lots of activities during the day throughout the year. From BINGO to live music on multiple stages something is always going on. Bring a sharpie and mark your visit with a permanent memory. Char-grilled oysters, burgers, seafood and bushwackers to enjoy. It truly is one of America's last great Roadhouse!

name: Rachel Graham
text: Great bar for locals and tourists alike.  Widely varied crowd, from wedding parties to divorce parties, 21st birthdays to 70+.  There are several bars within this bar and the music varies at each one so you will probably find something you like.  Great for people watching as well.  There are always lines of taxi's waiting to take you home at the end of the night so don't be a dummy and drink and drive there is no need.  Have your ID, they will check!! There are a lot of college kids, I usually never wear any type of college colors on game days.  Alcohol and sports don't mix well in the south :)

resp.text: That about sums it up! ;) We appreciate your review, Rachel. Hope to see you again soon.

name: Tiffani Avery
text: Super dead. Vibe was lacking luster. We left without even visiting the bar.

name: Amber Turrentine
text: Easy beach access. They have live music most of the time. My only complaint is that they are unorganized with food orders. I'm not sure if the buzzer didn't go off or if they skipped over my order but I had to wait over an hour for a 1/2 dozen oysters. They said they were "about to make them" 3 times. The food is expensive but that was expected.

name: David Mitchell
text: Always a great time, a grunge bar on the beach on steroids!

name: william eliason
text: This place was so fun. If you are in the area it is a must see!!

name: Nichole Bentley
text: Great tourist bar. Food was ok, music was great.

name: Teresa Pawl
text: landed here during songwriter festival and grammy winning songwriters singing their hits with the stories behind the song.  great bushwackers, if you add a shot of baileys. fun casual place.

name: thomas mitchell
text: It is the best slice to go when you want to get drunk

name: Emmy Nelson
text: Excellent food, service, & vibe!

name: Allen Petersen
text: This place is a must see to believe.  Awesome food. Great staff.  Plenty of parking.  Love it!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the great feedback, Allen! Come back and see us on the line soon! :)

name: Lee E. Joyce
text: Always fun!

name: Emily Boyd-Suter
text: Great for lunch when everything else was closed due to Hurricane Michael. The staff was polite and food was tasty, can't ask for much more.

name: Ronald Donahue
text: Loved it fun place food is great !

name: Lisa Thomas
text: This place is awesome.  So much history. Kenny Chesney's song about it says it all. We had a great time and will definitely be back.

name: Ruben Hernandez
text: If you know anything about the history here you will enjoy it, even if you don't go learn and maybe be apart of the history.

name: Andrew Fitzpatrick
text: The Perdido Brothers were a pleasant surprise on this random Wednesday night.  The place definitely did not disappoint.

name: Luke Fairbanks
text: Yuge. The place is a massive complex of spaces all dedicated to hosting tons of people. Good live music all the time, even for a person who doesn't prefer country. Bring a sharpie too & make your mark, there's thousands of signs from others on the walls.

name: Crystal Cornine
text: Normal stomping ground! Great oysters, awesome bands, and great drinks.

name: Teri Watson
text: The burger was great!

name: Lemont Bacy
text: A must see if you like live bands and plenty of good drinks. Never seen so many bars in one location. Definitely a must see when at Orange Beach

resp.text: We appreciate your review Lemont, see you next time!

name: John Smith
text: We were on vacation and went to the Flora Bama Yacht Club. We ate on the beach and the food was delicious. The mixed drinks are very reasonable. The bushwacker is a populat drink and packs a punch.

resp.text: Thanks for taking the time to let us know about your recent visit. So glad you all had a large time and enjoyed your dining experience with us! Hope to see ya'll back again soon :)

name: Brianna Lemay
text: Awesome music, great drinks, affordable prices. What more could you ask for?

name: sarah hernandez
text: employees were very rude tonigjt

resp.text:
Hi Sarah - Thank you for taking time to let us know about your recent visit to the Flora-Bama. On behalf of our team, please let me start by extending my sincerest apologies for the treatment you received from some of our staff. We absolutely do not tolerate this sort of behavior from our employees, and I would like to get a little more info from you if possible. Can you tell me what day/time you were here, any sort of description of what they looked like and/or where in the Flora-Bama did this occur?
Please know your comments have been passed to upper management, as well as our Ownership Team, for further review and action and, any additional info you may have would be helpful so that we may address this with the appropriate staff. Again, I'm so very sorry this happened but I would love to try and make things right. Please feel free to reach out to me directly with any other info you have using the following email address: blakeli@florabama.com.
I hope to hear back from you soon - Blakeli Calvert, Marketing Manager Flora-Bama

name: Dave Miller
text: A Gulf Coast staple, and I hope it lasts forever.  I revisited after being away for several years and was impressed by it's growth.  Best beach bar I've ever been acquainted with, and it will make you want to return to Perdido Key!

name: Ashley Crim- Smith
text: Best place to be anytime!!! Great customer service, kid friendly most of the time, and great place to make memories!!

name: Lucindy WeaverByrd
text: I didn't eat there I went on a Friday night it was packed out the drinks I had were good but cost $7 but that is how it is in a bar. Music was ok but every one was just standing around listening not dancing. I personally didn't like it because I like a DJ better

name: Debra Flythe
text: Great service and food and view.

name: Kimberly Clark
text: Great food and great service

name: Adam Brothers
text: Good atmosphere. Good drinks, live bands.

name: Andrew White
text: Kinda dirty feel but got great bushwhackers and large different areas for different feels and bands

name: ane h devries
text: Have to go here. It's so much fun. 3 bands playing.

name: Angie Golden
text: Nothing to write home about....over crowded and over priced bar with loud, ride people.

resp.text:
Hi Angie,
Thank you for taking time to let us know about your recent visit with us. We're so sorry to hear your experience at the Flora-Bama wasn't the best, was there something in particular that may have happened to cause a not-so-great night? Please know your comments have been passed to upper management for further review and action, and we do hope to have you back for a better visit next time you're in the area.

name: Jessie Lovell
text: Love playing bingo. Food great also

name: Dawn Eckhoff
text: The music The Heritage the drinks The Bushwackers how can you not love this place

name: B. Layton Arnold
text: Legendary bar on the Gulf Coast. Just one of those places you should go before you die. Nothing special - just simple fun at a big bar on the beach. Make sure to bring cash!

resp.text: We appreciate your review and hope to see you again soon! :)

name: kelly heimbach
text: Such a fun and interesting place!  Had the best drink ever there (key lime colada)! Great entertainment! Gotta visit the gift shop!

name: Eyes On
text: Historic place to visit, but on a rainy day not much to do here. If you like oysters you're okay otherwise head across the street for a better food selection.

resp.text: Hey there! Thanks for letting us know about your recent visit. The sunshine and warmer weather definitely helps the vibe and energy around here, but we try to make every day a fun day! Across the street at the Yacht Club and Ole River Grill, they have a much larger menu selection so we're happy you all were able to take a visit there. Hope to see ya back again soon :)

name: Keegan
text: We visited this place on August 4, 2019, and we were abruptly kicked out because two women entered the same stall because one needed medical help. We were then escorted downstairs without knowing where we were going. The person with medical problems was told that her eyes “looked glassy” and that the “U” on her hand was gone after washing her hands in the bathroom. We were then asked to leave, and we’re sent to the gift shop downstairs. I can’t say we will ever return here.

name: Zachary Brown
text: Best place every I'm from ohio ive been there 4 Times

name: Don Stallings
text: Simply amazing. I know nothing about the Marty's stickers

name: P Swift
text: Po Boy was small and not presented well for the price. Drinks were good though.

name: chad weathers
text: There are other places with better service and food if you just keep driving a couple of minutes down the road.

name: Christa Burton
text: Only reason 4 star is the fellow that was checking IDs and stamping hands was not a but friendly,  but sure why.  Everyone else was great, music in all 3 areas was GREAT!!

resp.text: Hi Christa - Thanks for taking time to let us know about your recent visit. On behalf of the Flora-Bama, I'd like to apologize for the distasteful welcome you all experienced. Please know your comments have been passed to upper management for further review and action. We do hope you'll come back to see us when in the area again as we'd love to show you a better start to a great night!

name: Scott Mansker
text: Historic Roadhouse bar. Good food and friendly staff.

name: Steph Eastwood
text: Always a to-do Everytime we vacation in Gulf Shores! Friendly staff, good entertainment, full of history!! Perseverance is prevalent!!

name: Fred Jeschke
text: Not impressed. Kinda dark and dirty in there. Waitress shorted us 2.50.

name: Megan Smith
text: We had a great time! Music was awesome, drinks were great! Thanks for the memories

name: Darrell Dougall
text: Not what a remembered from years ago. The quaint funky little play is now an overgrown complex and just another typical college bar.

name: Eddie Ledkins
text: Really good place to have a drink. Live entertainment laid back casual place.

name: LC T
text: This place is so fun!  Watch out-- the Bushwacker hits you when you least expect it!

name: Steven T
text: Love the atmosphere. Great music. A must visit.

name: Garrett Henson
text: Good music and good drinks

name: Glenn Morgan
text: Had a great time. Great live music and good drinks!

name: Sumit Sarkar
text:
Went on a Tuesday night when it was pretty quiet. Huge place that could be more clean. Perhaps the grime adds to the ambience. The staff was friendly and the specialty cocktails we ordered were half the price of most places. The only down side is they have limited ingredients at the bar, no Campari, for example. Still the bartender made a White Lady for us from my phone after I looked up the recipe. Their music acts even on a slow night are still good.

For families, come earlier in the afternoon and play bingo to win prizes. Under 18 have to leave by 6pm.

name: Jerry Lee
text: Careful place to go. The food was excellent. Great atmosphere.

name: Amanda Melton
text: Although it's gone a bit commercial, this place is the absolute definition of a dive bar. Being on the beach puts it over the top! Get a drink, walk out to the gulf and enjoy life! Shoes not necessary.

resp.text: You are absolutely right! Thank you :)

name: Bob Oliver
text: This bar was a lot of fun.  The live entertainer was fantastic.

name: Mary Baskett
text: What a unique place! Loved the "Duelling Pianos" show on Thursday evening.

resp.text: Thanks so much for letting us know about your recent visit! We're so happy to hear you all had a great time, the Dueling Pianos on Thursday nights is such a huge hit and we have big love for those guys! Hope to see ya back here On The Line again soon :)

name: Aaron Osborne
text: Like their saying says, good times and good music

name: Ginny Lyon
text:
Stopped by Flora-Bama restaurants/bars to check it out. It's right on the Florida Alabama line, and that's how it got it's name.
They have 2 restaurants on one side or the street and another along with some bars on the other side of the road. They have live music and offer free bingo certain days during the week. You really need to try the bingo it's a hoot. Not your ordinary bingo, it's all free! There is a gift shop as well.
Flora-Bama is right on the beach and the view is spectacular. Check out the sunset, beautiful.
If your visiting the Gulf Shores of Alabama or the areas of Pensacola, Florida you need to stop by to see it, it's nothing fancy...just down home fun!

resp.text: Thanks for the awesome review, Ginny! So glad you had a large time and we hope to see you back soon!

name: Sheila Steimel
text: Great music!! Love the atmosphere. Absolutely love you can hear the band on the beach!!

name: Trevor Shaw
text: Took a week quasivacation to help some friends at Snowball Derby and check out some new things. This place was next door to a condo rented. Walking the beach on Sunday around 8am and heard "High on that Mountain" while taking in the scenery and watching dolphins swim. It added to the experience. Then checked out the lounge and it was pretty damn cool. Atmosphere is great although didn't get past the second floor where band was playing. Acoustic duet was on point and staff was cool which brought it all together to make this place badass. I'm from Texas but will be returning as soon as I can to continue where I left off. Might even pick up a guitar myself and have a little fun. Definitely a place to go. No affiliation to gay ass MTV show.

name: Adam Brothers
text: Good atmosphere. Good drinks, live bands.

name: Della Hager
text: Good place to sign the walls,ceilings, roofs,tables,toilet seats and anywhere else there is a place.Been there had fun,good bands,had fun.ORIGINAL ROAD HOUSE !Great there is church on Sundays,,,Worship On The Water! People are great and laid back! Had a great time there the 5 months we were in the area,,,,hoping to make the area our home base!

name: chris banta
text: This place is very cool. The staff is very friendly and alot to see there. The drinks were cold. And the food is excellent and it has a nice gift shop.

name: David Burke
text: Great atmosphere. Expect to have your face melted off because of how hot it is though.

name: Andrew Fitzpatrick
text: The Perdido Brothers were a pleasant surprise on this random Wednesday night.  The place definitely did not disappoint.

name: Paul Corsa
text: We spent New Years Eve at the Flora-Bama. It was amazing to see such a crowd with no metal detectors; no visible fights; and everybody just having fun. 5$ cab rides were available all night for anyone who didn't feel up to driving home. We returned Sunday to attend Church and have breakfast after. What a wonderful way to share the floorspace and to help raise money for children's charities too. Keep up the good work.

resp.text: Thank you for your review! We are so glad you enjoyed your experience and look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: Gary Shekels
text: Great service. Great food. Good price. Clean restaurant.

name: Mary Baskett
text: What a unique place! Loved the "Duelling Pianos" show on Thursday evening.

resp.text: Thanks so much for letting us know about your recent visit! We're so happy to hear you all had a great time, the Dueling Pianos on Thursday nights is such a huge hit and we have big love for those guys! Hope to see ya back here On The Line again soon :)

name: James Holland
text: The church Is excellent this morning their service is great you need to go out and check out the Sunday morning service at the Flora bama at 9 and 11 o'clock and have a blessed day

name: Jim Overturf
text: Music was first rate. That is why you go there. Kinda dirty and not well kept in dome areas. Drinks are ok.

name: casey bates
text: A ton of fun! Can't wait to go back! Thinking of you guys during hurricane Michael!

name: Ann Aukerman
text: Fun place!

name: Bill Winnett
text: This place is amazing.

name: Ashley Lynn
text: Had a blast, got too drunk, someone stole my phone. Be on alert

name: Missy Rampage
text:
Just stopped for Powerball tickets.  That's on the inland side of the highway, y'all.
Quick and easy.

name: Lace Family Lace
text: Awesome location. It was a good time for all of us, especially the bingo caller who was having as much of a good time as we were. Although I gotta say, most people wash their bare feet off after leaving the beach, you wash your bare feet off after leaving the FloraBama. Also good if you need to purchase Florida lottery tickets, since Alabama does not have the lottery.

name: Lori Dalton
text: Fun and everyone's real nice

name: Bobby Barronton
text: We attended the  church at Flora-Bama. It was a great experience.

name: Alan Hutchens
text: Great place with live music.

name: Jamie C Gee
text: The Church service on Sunday Is the best thing about it other than souvenir shop. Food is a minus 5 stars even if your drunk

name: Chris Radloff
text: An institution rooted deep into Gulf Shores history. Have a Bushwacker or 2 and find a place to write your name somewhere in the bar and become a part of this iconic landmark.

name: John Meyer
text: Great place to hang out.

name: Beth Turner
text: Always fun! Great burgers, band was great

name: Heather Olson
text: Pretty neat place.

name: Trevor Shaw
text: Took a week quasivacation to help some friends at Snowball Derby and check out some new things. This place was next door to a condo rented. Walking the beach on Sunday around 8am and heard "High on that Mountain" while taking in the scenery and watching dolphins swim. It added to the experience. Then checked out the lounge and it was pretty damn cool. Atmosphere is great although didn't get past the second floor where band was playing. Acoustic duet was on point and staff was cool which brought it all together to make this place badass. I'm from Texas but will be returning as soon as I can to continue where I left off. Might even pick up a guitar myself and have a little fun. Definitely a place to go. No affiliation to gay ass MTV show.

name: Jaime Jordan
text: Was excited to visit since I was told this was a "must do" while in Orange Beach. I was not prepared for the roach infestation. They were everywhere!! After one crawled on me I had to leave. I would not recommend this place to anyone. Thankful I did not get any food only drinks.

name: casey bates
text: A ton of fun! Can't wait to go back! Thinking of you guys during hurricane Michael!

name: Pilar Vetsch
text: We always had fun at this place

name: Zachary Brown
text: Best place every I'm from ohio ive been there 4 Times

name: Don Stallings
text: Simply amazing. I know nothing about the Marty's stickers

name: James Jones
text: It is very large Place much bigger than you would think from the outside but once we went inside there wasn't many people but that was due to being in an offseason but if you're down there and you have a chance you should go because it's a very interesting historical place kind of a gym of the location

name: Renee Goertz
text: Always a blast. Every. Time

name: Michael Holley
text: Fun place, always live music with good food and great views

name: Joseph Le Vangie
text:
Real fun Bingoish games.  Not really Bingo just a few flexible rules. And then don't expect those to be enforced.
Live band Bushwackers and
friendly folk.

name: Matthew Rogers
text: You just have to see it

name: Kerry Douglas-Dupre
text: Great place to hangout was just really hot.

name: Beverly Maharg
text: Great music and reasonably priced beverages. Friendly people make it so fun!!

name: OverSizeDriver Local
text: Fun place to go With friends! The owners do little to do much up keep or keep the place clean. You don't want to go to the bathrooms without your waders or nose plug!

name: J T
text: Soooo much fun!  We love Stephanie who bartends upstairs.  New Years Eve Party was a blast too!

name: zach tolleson
text: A must experience for anyone in the area, very large with multiple bars, different bands for each area so your sure to find the music you like. Access to the beach and a beach bar area. There is food stands inside and a Waffle House across the street to fight off munchies.

name: Shelby Bordelon-Lee
text: Food was tasty, views were great, definitely will be back. I had the friend oyster basket, friend pickles and four cheese Mac and cheese and everything was enjoyed.

name: Ashley Strickland
text: We had a great time there and the customer service from Lorraine was top notch (hard to believe in a bar). She was very professional and helpful! Can't wait to go back next Summer!

resp.text: We look forward to seeing you again next summer!!

name: Matt Mikesh
text: What can you say? Its florabama!

name: JO LAPINSKI
text: Decent food, decent craft beer selection. We visited during a very cold snap in January, so not very lively. Would like to see it in the summer.

name: Rose Strotman
text: Love this place. Something fo4 all ages. Food is a little pricey. But beat dang burgers around. Servuce is great and friendly.

name: todd wilks
text: Great atmosphere!

name: Steve Zukowski
text: Big Earl puts on the best show!!!

name: Teresa McLain
text: Dirty, loud. Music was pretty good.

name: Robbie McPeek
text: It's very unique! You've got to go there at least once in your life. Lots of great entertainment daily!!

name: Lenesha Whorton
text: Really?  Need a review? Just go.

name: Sandra Zamora
text: Over rated looked run down to get so much attention. Didn't even eat there...workers never ask for an order so left.

name: Kaye Flegner
text: Was a great country singer there

name: T. Sinclair
text: This is literally one of our favorite restaurants EvEr and we live in Southern Indiana!! Everytime we come down to vacation, it's our first place we love to slip away to!! Fun atmosphere, staff, and decor... Not to mention the delicious food!! I wish we could go there more often, but it is 10 hr drive LoL very consistent and dependable though, considering how little we get the chance to go, they never fail to amaze us!!

name: Kevin Reid
text: So many great nights here, just not as many memories. There have been some epic night as this place and many more to come.

name: Jessica Harris
text: All I can say is WOW! Why do we not have a place like this where I'm from!

name: Debra Greene
text: Flora-Bama has always, always been the go to bar for a fun time- whether it's just a Bush Wacker and a jaunt on the beautiful beach or a fun time like the Mullet Toss!! They even have two church services at 9 & 11 a.m. on Sunday morning. Now come on, brotha & sista, who doesn't need some Jesus in ones' life! God is great and don't get me started on that because every good thing I have in my life is because of Jesus. Enjoy the Flora-Bama! And go to church some dang Sun. morning; I wouldn't be steering you wrong; honestly, Jesus is why I  am so happy. Smile! :):):):):):):):)

name: Lona Jacobson
text: Entertaining

name: Billy “Eric” Neese
text: Good place to visit and enjoy the music.

name: Dannie Metzger
text: Unique one of a kind place on the Florida Alabama state line. 6 bars, inside and outside seating, all types of music. Known for their Bushwacker frozen rum drink, be careful, more than one can be trouble.

name: Baleigh Hammitt
text: Yassss

name: Brody Casler
text: If you love that beach lifestyle, or if you just love good food and drinks, this is the place for you.

name: Laura Leduc
text: It's the Flora-Bama, pretty much her right of passage for young adults growing up near the Gulf of Mexico.

name: Jessica Elliott
text: Fun dive bar serving strong drinks just steps away from the beach! Two indoor bars with music playing, and an outdoor bar to serve the beach-goers, sunbathers, parents overseeing their little ones in the play area, picnic tables to eat at. They have a fantastic gift shop for all your memorabilia needs. Be sure to try a Bushwacker!

name: Lauren Brooke
text: I can't imagine what this place would be like during the summer! We were there in the winter and it was very chill.

name: chris banta
text: This place is very cool. The staff is very friendly and alot to see there. The drinks were cold. And the food is excellent and it has a nice gift shop.

name: Grady Hart
text: Great drinks because they have great bartenders.....Atmosphere plus....

name: Michael Gatson
text: Good Atmosphere!

name: Michael Cummings
text: Packed

name: Nikki Bullen
text: Fun atmosphere. Food was good, not much of a selection though. Definitely worth stopping by.

name: Dana Haynes
text: As the sign says, the only true Roadhouse left in America! My favorite place.

name: Evan Carey
text: Well its between Florida and Alabama...a big mix of people and tons of drinking. The crew working here is quick to clean up the messes created by the many gallons of beer consumed each second. Its a must see, just be prepared for the 21 year olds getting wasted to dealing with the 40 somethings reliving their 90s MTV spring break days. Great people watching.

name: J G
text: There's really no place like it. If you're into consistently killer live music, strong drinks with a weak price, or an unparalleled beach bar experience, then this is the place to go.

name: Taj Zaman (Dowagiac1990)
text: Couldn't believe how many people were there on a Sunday afternoon.  Great place for drinking a few bushwackers if you don't want to remember the rest of the night.  Energetic live bands with plenty of people dancing.

resp.text: Thanks for coming Taj! We hope to see you again soon :)

name: Annette Kenney
text: Awesome food, great prices!!! The souvenir shop is clean and organized. The upstairs bar had great views and strong drinks.

name: Bret Berglund
text: Great fun place and is very popular. The oysters on the half were good too.

name: Julie H.
text: Fun. Good beer and music. Great atmosphere.

name: kelly turner
text: We were there 5 minubefore we noticed huge roaches scurrying around everywhere, one even crawled up my sisters dress! So disgusting I’m surprised to not see other reviews about their roach problem. We left immediately and will not be back.

name: J Robert Moffitt (Rob)
text: We had an awesome time. We were there during the off season so we would like to come when the beach is more active and the bar is full. Highly recommended.

resp.text: You would have a great time in season! The high energy environment is exhilarating! Come back and see us :)

name: Jaime Jordan
text: Was excited to visit since I was told this was a "must do" while in Orange Beach. I was not prepared for the roach infestation. They were everywhere!! After one crawled on me I had to leave. I would not recommend this place to anyone. Thankful I did not get any food only drinks.

name: lynn bobik
text: Still has the feeling of the sixties since it opened in 1964. Miss the canvas roofs.

name: Debora Cahoon
text: Sorry, but this place is real Getto. I couldn’t sit down anywhere and enjoy the view because there were cigarette stems everywhere, there was gum on the floor and walls, and it was really dirty.  We didn’t stay

resp.text:
Hi Debora,
Thanks for letting us know about your recent visit. Please know your comments have been passed to upper management for further review and action. We do apologize for the experiencing you had, and we hope you all give us another try on your next visit.

name: Judith Hopwood
text: Okay so it's dirty! But that's my only complaint! Great beach and view. Unique place with multiple separate areas to chill in and a gift shop

resp.text: Thank you for your review! We hope to see you again soon!

name: Marcus Watts
text: First time to the panhandle and I loved it, my parents are moving down from Maine in Oct so we came to help them check out the area! Our first night we were told to go have a Bushwacker, and the first person we met was Michelle,at the door she has this perfect southern charm with these amazing blue eyes. She took the time to explain all about the bar and tell us the bands that were playing that night, and the restaurants across the st. We had such a great time up in the main bar, the taco truck was so good, best drinks and the people we had conversation with! I came back the next night just to see Michelle and then I met Jackie (what a hoot they are). Can't wait to see them in Oct...someone tell Michelle she still owes me that dance!

name: Shannon Sahm
text: Oysters were awesome.  Service was ok. Great spot! :)

resp.text: So glad ya'll enjoyed the oysters! Was there anything in particular that happened with service? Your comments have been passed to upper management for review and action, so any other info you may have would be appreciated! Hope to see you back again soon :)

name: Monica Corpus Smith
text: We did not get a chance to eat there, we were party of 40 and it was a packed house. Although we did visit the gift shop - the walls were decorated with cool looking t-shirts and they had neat knickknacks. We spent over $100/bucks for 3-shirts and a hat. 😬 But we did enjoy the Flora-Bama waterfront views.

resp.text: Thank you for your rating! We would love to hear more about your experience with us, we hope you had a great time.

name: Calvin
text: Stop in a get a bushwhacker and sing along to a few songs, good times will be had! Definitely an older crowd. If older, promiscuous women on girls trip vacations is your thing, you'll be right at home.

name: Denise Bourg
text: Cool venue just way too hot

name: Betsy Swoner
text: Always Interesting place

name: Cleetus Witherspoon
text: this is my favorite place away from home!!! my favorite time is the frank brown songwriters festival but i'm sure the rest of their events are awesome. you would think after 20 years i would just move there. Thought about it many times.

name: Racheal Trevathan
text: Flora-Bama is now and has always been the best on the Gulf coast.

name: Intercoastal Safaris
text: This establishment is much more than the "worlds greatest beach bar". It is a community center, church, restaurant, marina, place of employment for many & our "Go To' spot for entertaining clients.

name: Liliana Vargas
text: Absolutely my favorite restaurant/bar in the area! Visited Flora-Bama for the first time during my stay in Gulf Shores about two weeks ago and I could not say enough good things about this place. GREAT bands/music, the food was far better than I expected, the drinks were decently priced. If you're in the area I would recommend you visit.

name: William
text: Was there the Saturday before Easter and had a great time.  Took my 23 year old daughter and she loved it as well.  There is something for everybody...if you don`t have fun at the Flora-Bama is your own fault.

resp.text: Thank you for your review! We certainly try to cater to all ages. We have tons of events coming up and hope to see you all back again soon!

name: Shelley Farley
text: Typical bar food, great atmosphere.

name: Angela Maxwell
text: Memories I love all the memories

name: Scott King
text: Great bar and atmosphere was rustic and charming. Local bar feel. Good service, reasonable prices, great music

name: Julie Watts
text: Shrimp tacos are delicious. Enjoyed watching the Pelicans fish while we ate.

name: Trish Cox-Netecke
text: Cool place, lots to see & do.  Food was not what I expected, but good atmosphere & friendly people.  Gotta put on your bucket list

resp.text: So glad you all had a large time! Hope to see ya back here on the line soon!

name: Jack Sorrells
text: Big Earl is a must see. The band is great.

resp.text: Most definitely! Not for the easily offended, but such a large time! Hope to see ya back again soon :)

name: Caroline Cooper
text: This place is super fun. Such a neat eclectic atmosphere

name: Ted Bond
text: BEST BAR ON THIS PLANET!

name: Deanna Lee Kluchko
text: I LOVE it here! You must try the bushwacker! Live music, good food and great drinks!

name: Chris Childers
text: Very good food, nice atmosphere

name: Doug Gillespie
text: Very unique and fun spot to stop. A must see when you are crossing the state line.

name: Brian McInerny
text: Don't get the appeal.  Food was the most mediocre we had during our vacation in Orange Beach.  We went at lunch, so maybe it's better at night.

name: Douglas Flanery
text: Great place to visit, but very rude employees for the cover charge. We have spent about 200.00 the last 3 days at the Florbama bar. We left to go across the street to the Florabama grill, I asked if we needed to be stamped  the lady said just bring your receipts. I did and they wanted 15.00 for us to return. Not good customer relations and especially for returning paying customers. Tonight was probably my last night at the Florabama!!!!!!!

name: Diane Peterson
text: Off season and a Monday night.  I did not have high expectations.   It was fine.

name: Joseph Heckler
text: Great atmosphere, food, and drinks!

name: Stephen Pridgen
text: Frank Brown music venue is AWESOME!!

name: Brian Dodd (BD)
text: I only visited the loto store today. However I've been the the florobama many times. The sandy floors and the disposable bars are a staple along the gulf coast. U can't say u visited orange Beach I'd u didn't visit the Flora-Bama.

resp.text: Hey there! Thanks for letting us know about your recent visit, we're glad you had a great time! Hope to see ya back again soon :)

name: DL Bradford
text: Such fun! Bingo in the afternoon and bands at night.

name: Rebecca Bottoms
text: Good food, good drinks, amazing atmosphere. Thanksgiving was fun!

name: clayton west
text: The annual mullet toss was a great attraction.   We go every year.

resp.text: So glad ya'll had a great time at our Interstate Mullet Toss! It was a great time had by all and we hope to see ya back again soon :)

name: Yoao Liscano
text: Exelent

name: Roger Marti
text: Awesome place. Live music, good drinks, cheap prices.

name: amber kinney
text: Legendary beach bar to visit with a fun atmosphere. 4 stars given due to smelling like smoke and deep fry when you leave.

name: Charles Schenher
text: Convenient to get lotto tickets but the prices are way too high on their liquor

name: Isolde Rothery
text: This is a great venue for live music

name: Immanuel Strong
text: Best bar and atmosphere on the Gulf Coast

name: Jeff Tharp
text: Best of the best

name: April Nucete
text: We had so much fun :)

name: Tiffany Alexander
text: So we lucked up and went here on a Monday, the open mic night was great and the place wasn't overly crowded, good service,  great bushwackers. I recommend coming to the open mic night in the main bar. Otherwise the place is a bit dirty and crowded on other nights

name: Ruben Torres
text: Great spot to have some/ a lot of drinks. Live bands and lots of people watching. Huge place.

name: Cherry Fe fowler
text: If you have never been you haven't lived,  make sure to add to your bucket list,  and you will not be disappointed!

name: Randy Holbrooks
text: We first went to the Flora bama about 30 years ago.  It's clearly changed a lot and might be better described as Flora bama Inc today.  Which is okay and you should still visit if you've never been.  But it ain't what it was those years back.

name: Jerry Van Horne
text: Coolest beach bar ever..lots of history..super friendly!!

name: Romey
text: Five of us walked up on a Monday at 6:30 and were greeted by friendly staff. Was told that there was a $10.00 cover per person for over 21 and an $15.00 for under 21 which would have bent me over for $60.00 just to walk in. It was explained to me that it is because there were two bands playing. 1) It was a Monday, no one there and I get charged to walk in. 2) I have to pay for your band to entertain me? This is why you have a band, is to draw people to your establishment. The 5 of us walked out and I drove down the road a few miles to Mike's seafood where we had had a great dinner and drinks and spent $135.00 .....Without a cover.

name: Lacey McElderry
text: Bushwhackers, ANAZING Beach, several different rooms with different themes, and church on Sundays? Yep that's right church on Sundays! Worship On The Water! It's really interesting to see everyone walking in with their Bibles. Wish I had a picture of that for my review.

resp.text: Thank you for you review! We are glad you enjoyed your experience with us and look forward to your next visit :)

name: Claudia Carley
text: Great Party times!

name: Julie Taylor
text: The free bingo on weekday afternoons is a nice experience!

name: jkjk 3524
text: Cool decor and atmosphere!

name: SP Thomas
text: What a great time, bingo was super fun, and the bushwackers well you'll have to try for yourself

name: derrick jackson
text: Been here several times over the years just seems like they're trying to squeeze more and more out of you with the drinks. The Bushwackers or almost half the size that they used to be for the same price. But the price of the drinks doesn't bother you the atmosphere is always great.

name: Chaney Cloud
text: Hands down best bar ever. Hospitality and atmosphere 2nd to none. We drive from Southwest Louisiana and spend 3 days strictly to go here. Put it on your bucket list!!

name: Richard Daniel
text: Great atmosphere, great music and great food!

name: Anne Marie Doherty
text: It was like being at a three day. Concert, damn those Bushwackers lol

name: Shelly Majors
text: Loved it nlu place to go if u in gulf shores

name: ursula roberts
text: It's fun, but expensive. Parasail coupons are no good here

name: Barbara Glover
text: So much fun for 95 year olds to young children

name: Mike Varnado
text: Awesome place....Lots of cool history

name: Jason Anderson
text: The food is blah, but the scenery is incredible!

name: paul clifton
text:
Our friends go here often.
It is in my list to go there when U leave Pensacola

name: Sam Way
text: It was a neat place but it had mediocre food. Small choice of items. We ate at the grill across from the bar.

name: Jane Vandehey
text: Always fun, good drinks and great staff

name: mike cowhey
text: Too many middle aged divorced old broads. You'll get in trouble if you are over 30. But don't worry they are gone by the end of the first set.  Babysitter has to go home, has the early shift at wallmart, just too damn tired and no hot prospects.   Good bands fun and pretty cool. Enjoy

name: Joyful Life
text: Wonderful thanksgiving spot with my nieces

name: Ashton Roland Hall
text: The flora Bama probably has to be one of best bars I have ever been to, and the oyster bar has the best food. Also a great thanks to a character named Tim for making my time special.

name: Robert Swain
text: Outstanding service... Went on a Monday... Slow... But great entertainment

name: Mike Johnson
text: Great place for bushwhackers and smoked tuna dip. Always fun no matter when you go

name: Caleb Derrington
text: Fun place. Icon for the area.

name: Sarah Murrell
text: Worst restaurant experience we've had in a long time. My boyfriend and I drove down to gulf shores from Nashville for my birthday this past week and decided to make the 45 minute drive to Flora-Bama from our hotel because several friends had recommended it. We get there and decided to grab food at their Ole River Grill before heading over across the street to the main building. As soon as we got out of the car, slimy guys is cowboy hats were yelling inappropriate comments at women walking by and tryin to start an argument with our group. Then we get to the door, guy says we have to go down stairs to order food so we go down, grab a slightly too small table because all of the others are dirty, and sit and wait. And wait. And wait. Eventually, a server comes over, asks if we're there for food or drinks, we tell them both as he's running around us, not even fully addressing our table. He quickly says "kitchens closed" and walks off. (Even though the guy upstairs had just told us to come downstairs if we wanted food and the restaurant didn't close for several hours) Didn't off a drink, apology, or say another word. Obviously just trying to get us out of the restaurant. I don't know if they are just poorly ran or if it's because some people in our group are black, but definitely did not feel even remotely welcomed and would not recommend this place to ANYONE.

name: Brock Mclean
text: Best beach bar period.  Possibly the best bar.  Great food at the yatch club.  I mean where else can you hear great live music all day long and be at the beach or pull up in your boat on the intercoastal? No where that I know of.

resp.text: We absolutely agree with you Brock :) Thanks so much for your review. Hope to see you again soon.

name: Donovan Prestella
text: My wife and my mom both had a good time. It was relatively cheap, too. Can't ask for much more.

name: Glenn Davis
text: Great music! Lots of fun!

name: Louis Bird
text: Great music and food

name: Alan Hutchens
text: Great place with live music.

name: charlotte hudson
text: Had a great time Mother's day. The flowers you gave us was very nice too.

name: Gary Neat
text: Fun bar and atmosphere. Music was good and drinks were reasonable. They have pool, shuffle board and foosball

name: Peggy Neff
text: Everybody loves Florabama!.  Very comunity oriented from all kinds of music to great drinks to bingo to even church on Sundays.  Right on the boarder of Florida and Alabama.  A must place to go to.  All ages from Seniors to college students. Always events going on.

name: T Ferguson
text:
I am writing this from a parents perspective.  Went here for lunch and bingo.  Lunch was overpriced.  Shrimp basket $10 for about 6 popcorn shrimp and some fries.  Famous bushwhackers a were almost $8 a pop.

Bingo caller...  They changed callers recently.  The man they had in the past was humorous, good with kids, and fun.  The new caller was very very slow.  We were there for 90 mins and she called 4 games.  The prizes are t shirts, signed copies of books they sell in the gift shop, etc.  nothing expensive.  Which is fine, and all the more reason you should call fast and give the kids a chance to win.  The new caller also told a lot of stories about her deceased husband and country music from the 60s.  Not to exciting for kids.

name: Dan Garcia
text: Great atmosphere! Drinks and bands were awesome.  Ocean views does not hurt.

name: Lenesha Whorton
text: Really?  Need a review? Just go.

name: Ashley Lynn
text: Had a blast, got too drunk, someone stole my phone. Be on alert

name: Vicki Darnell
text: Fun place to check out. Nice inventory of FloraBama t-shirts and gifts. Famous for the Bushwhacker drink.

name: clayton west
text: The annual mullet toss was a great attraction.   We go every year.

resp.text: So glad ya'll had a great time at our Interstate Mullet Toss! It was a great time had by all and we hope to see ya back again soon :)

name: Adam “Adamo” Aschenbrenner
text: Trashy music venue/dive bar(I like dive bars). I probably would have given it 5 stars 20 years ago. I am too old for that now.

name: Don Heatherly
text: Rowdy crazy fun place. A must do.

name: Angela McGinnis
text: What's not to love...

name: Maggie Foster
text: Awesome atmosphere,  great drinks and beautiful entrance to the beach. Get the bushwacker

name: Mj Farnsworth
text: Played Bingo and ate chicken fingers...Had a great time...The fellow  who calls the numbers is funny as all get out we all had a great time!

name: Marie “Keela” Horton
text: First visit ever, I live in Alabama what great place. Doesn't matter what age,we went every day we was in Gulfshores and definitely will go back . Ate my first raw oyster and loved them.

name: Brent Curtin
text: We rent pontoon boats and they are really nice boats. Good place to rent a boat for the day

name: SETH GILBREATH
text: Loved the music and drinks

name: Josh Boyd
text: Great setting and atmosphere

resp.text: Thanks Josh, we're so happy to hear you enjoyed your time with us! Hope to see you back again soon!

name: Augie Diaz
text: You want to have fun go there

name: Lynnette Newman
text: They were out of pasta to make the mac and cheese seafood and the seafood tower.  Drinks were just ok, nothing special.  Food was average.  A place to visit one time for the history, but won't go back.

name: Steve Ozburn
text: Great place to hang out with beautiful girls! Three stages of music! Great people,Great Bartenders, and Great Security!

name: Dave Larson
text: Great times. Dueling pianos a ton of fun

name: michelle schmidt
text:
This place is awesome!!! As u walk in the shabby looking establishment u are greeted with a store of stuff, believe me this stuff is quality and u will want to procure some, but as I walked in I was huh why? You will figure it out.
There are several bars to fit every ones fancy.  ...and speaking of fancy the food is amazing. If u get lucky u can watch them shuck Oysters or peel huge Shrimp. I could smell the jalapenos on the nachos wow!!! One more or two more tho us I gotta say their drinks are delicious one of the best Bushwackers.
LOVED THE FACT YOU CAN WALK TO THE BEACH. BTW KENNY CHESNEY played there a while back pretty cool. I could go on I will add more.

name: Lauren Stewart
text: Had the bushwhacker with floater of butterscotch and bra flinger. Great atmosphere got a T-shirt and just chilled. Dog friendly too! They brought our dogs some water too!!! Thanks flora bama

name: Della Hager
text: Good place to sign the walls,ceilings, roofs,tables,toilet seats and anywhere else there is a place.Been there had fun,good bands,had fun.ORIGINAL ROAD HOUSE !Great there is church on Sundays,,,Worship On The Water! People are great and laid back! Had a great time there the 5 months we were in the area,,,,hoping to make the area our home base!

name: g1ngermane
text: Local institution, apparently this place gets weird but I'm down here during snow bird season.  So the only thing weird is the walkers without tennis balls.  Lots of Jimmy Buffet covers to be heard if you appreciate that sort of noise.

resp.text: Thanks for the feedback! We all get a little weird around here, but it makes for good times! Hope to see ya again soon here on the line :)

name: Donna Smallwood
text: Service was great service was awesome bands were awesome especially the one in the main bar had a ball thank you very much

name: Ashley Aaron
text: Awesome place. Live music and after 6 mainly for adults.

name: Leigh Trail
text: Cool place with good live music

name: Casey Hooper
text: One of my favorite places. Was thrown out about 10 yrs ago. I went back last night on a Monday night and had a great time. Plan on making it to the mullet toss in the future.

resp.text: Casey, thanks for taking time to leave a review and we hope to see you for Mullet Toss!

name: Joan Knallay
text: A very interesting bar & food place on the beach. Great staff.  Fun place.

resp.text: Thanks Joan! Hope to see ya again soon!

name: Ruth Olsen
text: Great views. Staff and service.  Small size drinks, food ok.  Had better in the area

name: Pam Ward
text: Oysters made me sick for 3 days. Food is not fresh and they could care less!  This place is all about getting drunk the food is just the aftermath. Staff is lacking on important  issues.Will not ear here again.

name: Tori Sanford
text: The food was excellent! Customer service was superb. Atmosphere was so easy going. We will be back!

name: Wicked Taxi
text: Ubers and lyfts dropping off in the middle of the road and picking up.  Accepting cash and transporting too many people illegally

resp.text: Hi there - Thanks so much for letting us know... We'd like to get a little more info from you if possible. Would you mind emailing me so that we can get some details? Blakeli Calvert , blakeli@florabama.com

name: KriSSy Johnson
text: Great place to have a few drinks day or night .  At night it turnes into a full on club/bar with many fun environments to pick from

name: C Pilkington
text: Not the Florabama from my college days but still a great spot! Had a great time!

name: david grafe
text: Always have a great time at Flora-Bama. We went to play bingo. We didn't win but had fun good food and drinks while we were there.

name: Shawn Gill
text: Great place, only issue was the smoking.

name: Donna spriggs
text: Cool hangout! Check it out if your in the area.  Great bushwhackers!

name: C W
text: Never a dull moment at the Flor-A-Bama! Always excellent music and too notch drinks. Never had a dull moment here in the decades I’ve been visiting whenever down on the beach. It’s been the subject of songs from Jimmy Buffet to JJ Grey & Mofro. If you’ve never been, you don’t know what a party you are a missing!

name: P Swift
text: Po Boy was small and not presented well for the price. Drinks were good though.

name: Gary Neat
text: Fun bar and atmosphere. Music was good and drinks were reasonable. They have pool, shuffle board and foosball

name: Rose Strotman
text: Love this place. Something fo4 all ages. Food is a little pricey. But beat dang burgers around. Servuce is great and friendly.

name: Brock Mclean
text: Best beach bar period.  Possibly the best bar.  Great food at the yatch club.  I mean where else can you hear great live music all day long and be at the beach or pull up in your boat on the intercoastal? No where that I know of.

resp.text: We absolutely agree with you Brock :) Thanks so much for your review. Hope to see you again soon.

name: Tiffany Alexander
text: So we lucked up and went here on a Monday, the open mic night was great and the place wasn't overly crowded, good service,  great bushwackers. I recommend coming to the open mic night in the main bar. Otherwise the place is a bit dirty and crowded on other nights

name: Brendan Pelto
text: It is a labyrinth of bars. Many different bands playing at different levels and decks. Food trucks offer great food. Taxis are easily accessed.

resp.text: Thanks for the review Brendan! Hope to see you back again soon!

name: Claudia Carley
text: Great Party times!

name: Rhonda Ivey
text: Awesome Party place !!

name: Michael Day
text: My brothers band played their Friday night a great place for people 21 to 91 nothing else like it anywhere.

name: Conner Bice
text: DONT LET MTV SCARE YOU AWAY FROM THIS PLACE! They filmed the show 3 hours away in Panama City. This is a very respectable restaurant/bar and I don’t want anyone getting the wrong impression from a reality TV show. I’ve always had a great time at FloraBama and don’t have anything bad to say. name: T Ferguson
text:
I am writing this from a parents perspective.  Went here for lunch and bingo.  Lunch was overpriced.  Shrimp basket $10 for about 6 popcorn shrimp and some fries.  Famous bushwhackers a were almost $8 a pop.

Bingo caller...  They changed callers recently.  The man they had in the past was humorous, good with kids, and fun.  The new caller was very very slow.  We were there for 90 mins and she called 4 games.  The prizes are t shirts, signed copies of books they sell in the gift shop, etc.  nothing expensive.  Which is fine, and all the more reason you should call fast and give the kids a chance to win.  The new caller also told a lot of stories about her deceased husband and country music from the 60s.  Not to exciting for kids.

name: Kelly Cano
text: Divided into many rooms so you can find the type of music that you like they even have a nice church service on Sundays decent prices for where you're at on the beach and always something fun to see great oysters try the grilled ones! Experts say only eat raw oysters in months that have an R in them.

name: Paige Sabo
text: Awesome entertainment, the entire place just really seemed to be alive. I got some queso fries and they were pretty solid, I suggest getting the cheese on the side to dip so your fries don't get soggy. The bushwackers are what Florabama is known for. It's basically an ice cream shake, but half full of alcohol. My boyfriend's dad said that they don't serve you more than two to you! Florabama also has a boardwalk in the back that leads right to the beach and was perfect for watching the sunset come down. If you're looking for seashells, there's plenty of those too. There's three different spots where the band plays and you can walk around and experience all the different types of music in one night! The service was great and personable as well.

name: Dustalynn Durbin
text: What a place! There is no lack of entertainment here! Live music, several different bars, multi level place. There is beach access here, to come and go to the beach while you visit. There are thousands of bras,and swimsuit tops hanging from various places on the ceiling. If youre not ready for a good time, don't go!

text: Me and my better half went here for New Year’s Eve (2017 $40 per person) and let me just say I was extremely disappointed! I will first start by saying it’s obvious it was all about making $$$, the event, bash whatever you want to call it was WAY too crowded. In other words if they had 2500 tickets to sell it should have been more like 1750. Sooooo many people were crammed into this place it was not only ridiculous but flat out DANGEROUS...I have frequented this place many times in the past but this experience has sealed the deal for me on never to return. I could continue with the negatives but quite honestly it’s not worth my time. Hopefully for other fun seekers sake Flora-Bama can get it right in the future....Just my 2 cents.

name: Jessica Croat
text: My Family and i came to Alabama specifically for this bar. We drove all the way from Minnesota with 4 of us. We first got there (Monday) and it was pretty low key which we understood given the day. The gift shop was very nice. Probably the nicest area in the whole bar. Bought some shirts saw a band and then we headed over to their 2nd bar for dinner. They didn’t have oysters that we ordered and the prime rib that my boyfriend ordered never came along with his drink he ordered. I will give the manger props he did say the truck for oysters should be here any min and said the first round of them were on us. Got them and they were great. We visited the main bar 3 times within 5 days thinking the later in the week it got there the more entertainment there would be. We did listen to a good one man band that sang country the 2nd time we were there, but the 3rd topped my anger level. Which is why I’m writing a bad review. Last Thursday march 31st 2016 we went to the main bar where we saw that they had someone singing (who was on break). Our group of 4 got a front row seat. Than we started chatting with another family behind us and while this was happening our entertainment was setting back up to perform again. I guess I didn’t notice that he had started but he made sure that I knew he did because I guess I was being too loud. A group of locals felt the same way and encouraged his behavior which was to call me out in front of everyone saying he couldn’t play because I was being too distracting (Too LOUD). It’s not like I was screaming or fighting with anyone. I was simply talking with my family and learning more about the area with the new people we had met. I found it extremely inappropriate that he would ever say anything to me. I’m on vacation to see this place and have a good time. We simply just walked out. So to round up my experience here I would say definitely disappointing. I don’t get out of Minnesota often and when I do again I wouldn’t go here. There is nothing special about this place unless you like dark lighting, Smokey rooms, being called out on having fun and an old atmosphere. The Hangout on the other hand was a great place for not only my family but so many others. Now that is a tourist place that people should talk about.

name: Jim Hilker
text:
FloraBama is one of those places you simply have to visit when you're in the area.  Check your expectations before you go there, it's not fancy - it's a biker bar type place, but LOADS of fun and situated right on the beach.  I have not been there for food, and not sure it is the kind of place that I would eat at, for no other reason than for me it seems like a place to enjoy beer, sand, sun, and surf, and some wild times.  Last time I was there they had two live bands playing, one inside and one outside.
It's really quite a large place, built like it was just added on to 8 or more times.  You feel like you can lost there at first.
I walked across the road to their other places on the bay.  I didn't stay, but next time I'll check them out.
I recommend you experience FloraBama - it's pretty cool!

text:
A must-stop-by spot on the Alabama/Florida line.

This place is definitely a scene. Super friendly staff, six stages/rooms/bars, live music, TVs, etc. Though the place was fairly dead on a Wednesday night, it was still a fun spot to watch the Cubs win the World Series and play some Buck Hunter.

The food is ok, not great. The frickles are complete salt bombs, all salt and batter, no pickle taste. Huge portion though. The fries were kinda boring but the wings had a good sauce on them that was surprisingly hot.

Check out the daiquiris, especially on a hot day!

name: TheDeerslayer863
text: Across the street from bar- Service was good but that was about it. I had the fried shrimp platter for 14 dollars and the quantity was for a child. My wife had a burger and it was a nasty bubba burger. Needles to say she was sick throwing up the rest of the night. They have no regular beer on tap, only regular beer they have is in a can for 3.00  i will not be going back.

resp.text: I am sorry to hear your experience was unsatisfactory, if there is anything we can do please call us at (850) 492-0611.

name: Alexis Schlueter
text: I live in St. Louis Missouri and travel down to the area every September for a two week vacation. One of my absolute favorite things to do is to go to the Flora Bama multiple times during my trip and have a Bama burger. I  look forward to it every year. I just went for the first time this year tonight to be highly dissapointed. Not only have the prices increased, the fries have been changed completely, no more sweet potato fries, and the bun was changed from a Hawaiian bun to a brioche bun. If you want to change a burger, MAKE A NEW BURGER! Don't call it the same thing. Flora Bama is turning from a quality, fun establishment to being money hungry and giving lower quality food. All this paired with the warm beer, I don't have a high desire to come back.

name: Dan Arbuckle
text:
Atmosphere was great, service was awful. I really enjoyed the atmosphere that Flora-Bama offers, with the live music and spring break happening, I couldn't have ask for more in a bar. However, the staff was shockingly rude. I just turned 21 and from Minnesota. When you renew your drivers license in MN, you are given state issued "papers" before your new license arrives in the mail. When I tried presenting my clipped license with my government issued papers, I was denied service and was threatened to be kicked out. The Flora-Bama is really a nice place, but I encourage their management and staff members to work on how they treat their guests.

Fair warning: You won't be let in if you plan on using your government issued ID and papers. Also, come with a fat wallet because drinks are expensive and weak (Friends opinion)

name: Melody Klick
text: First walking in to flora bama everything was fine after eating there over priced  not so good food. I walked into the gift shop with my boyfriend To look around. As we were leaving the gift shop to meet up with his parents were they were sitting by the band, we were stopped by an older woman with a bad attitude because of our age. I understand how there could be an under age drinking problem due to the amount of intoxicated people running around. How ever the way she spoke to us was incredibly rude and she could have been nicer. She continued to be rude  questioning us as if we were doing something wrong and asked for my id. She tried to make us pay 15 dollars each even though we had already been there for a while. I showed her my i.d then she asked for our hands and put a wrist band and scribbled a huge U on each hand . she grabbed my boyfriends hand taking the permanent marker going back and fourth to make the mark even bigger she did the same on mine, almost in a way to be ignorant. she told us to not take the marker or the wrist band off talking to us like we were stupid.  Later walking out my boyfriend was also accused of drinking which he hadn't been. The least to say we are never coming back . Itss sad to say that one employee can ruin a whole experience.

name: Christiana Goods
text: Went to have dinner with my brother and sister along with our spouses last night. They had a wait time of 20-30 minutes which was no problem. We decided go get a drink at the bar while we wait. The bartender was awesome and very friendly. The hostess then proceeded to seat us at a table that had been vacant the entire wait (20-25 mins) which we blew off. After being seated we waited to be acknoledged for 15 more minutes before we asked multiple servers if we had an assisgned server. Two of which proceeded to discuss who’s section it was and how they would figure something out, and another server we told “no one has even acknoledged we are here or said hi to us or anything” replied to us “well hi” and walked off. This place looked like they had a great menu and it certainly smelled delicious but the staff was incredibly rude and ill mannered and for that reason alone I will never patronize this place again!

resp.text: Ms. Goods, I am so sorry for the situation which occurred. Our management and ownership want to make sure that every meal is presented properly and guests enjoy their experience. We would like to know which restaurant you were at during the situation. If you could please reply at this link it would be very helpful:  http://www.florabama.com/contact.html   I will follow-up with you shortly and again my deepest apology for the problem.

name: Dean
text:
I have been to the Flora-Bama many times over the past years.  Really enjoy my trips to Gulf Shores/Orange Beach.  As always, the Flora-Bama is a must do.  But this will be my last trip.   I have watched the place grow, be torn downed from hurricane, and continue to add on.  The facility is definitely a unique icon.  The facility and staff all are great.  It's the entertainment that was truly disgusting.  My wife and I made it to the stage area downstairs and tried to listen to the band before giving up a leaving.  The idea of playing various songs and interacting with the crowd is great idea and great response.  BUT the main member of the Band is very crude and disgusting!  Can he not play a song without grabbing his crotch and cussing like that to people!?  One lady even tried to buy him a drink, and he told her, with several vulgar words, he didn't want that!  If she can't bring him  'x', then just get out!
I've seen this singer before, but don't remember him being that vulgar!  Time for some new entertainment.  I would think that the Flora-Bama could easily find excellent band/entertainer to fill that position.

name: LeAnne Lane
text:
THE BEST (BIKER) BEACH BAR YOU WILL FIND!!!!
THE Original BIKER BEACH BAR- celebrating its 50th anniversary this year. The Florabama offers multiple live bands playing on multiple stages. If your on a bike....or on 4 wheels....You've GOT TO STOP IN HERE and check it out!! Good food. Great Bushwackers! Live music. And all out access to the beautiful white sand beaches that only the Gulf has to offer!! Also home of the annual "Mullet Toss Contest"! Absolutely a MUST SEE if your visiting the area!! Never a dull moment! Every week has a different headline! Seriously the best on the beach!!
I live here, and its still my favorite place on earth!

name: Na Na
text:
Ugh, where do I start? As an avid bar hopper I've been to a lot of bars, some good...some not so much. I was really looking forward to Flora-Bama, the name alone just exudes fun. The hype was there, the reviews were there, and then i was there...and soooooo let down.

To be fair, it was a Tuesday night at 1030 in September...but this place was not the spot that I soooo hoped it would be. It was dead, I mean except the over 45 folk that were there with a DJ that resembled a older, not so awesome Ted Nugent. Now, that is not necessarily the bars fault. But this is.. this place is a hodge -podge of bad additions which include multiple bars, a gift shop, outdoor venues, and a wierd staging area for things that don't have a home (grills, coolers,etc.). The building was run down and had no flow from one area to another. There was a wierd smell I and only describe of disel fuel and butt, laced with the waftyness of years of nicotine build up. It was the kinda place that made me want to go shower to excape the smell.

There were several places for live music, but  was none, except for some guy picking at a guitar. The "band", all two members, were to busy mingling and not to worried at all about playing. Did I tell you how high my hopes for this place was!? Now, they did have a awesome liquor distribution room. Every bottle in this large room was piped right into the bars for equal and accurate pours. It was really impressive and on display for you to be in awe. All-in-all, I guess if it was spring break and I was super drunk this place COULD be good. But it still feels a bit dingy. I do hope to revisit, hopefully at a different time of  year. Maybe the embiance changes from season to season, but for a bar that has the reputation that this one does, my group and I was let down..hard and my buzz was killed. In all honesty, I would have given it a 2.5 stars..but that was not a option.

name: Dean
text:
I have been to the Flora-Bama many times over the past years.  Really enjoy my trips to Gulf Shores/Orange Beach.  As always, the Flora-Bama is a must do.  But this will be my last trip.   I have watched the place grow, be torn downed from hurricane, and continue to add on.  The facility is definitely a unique icon.  The facility and staff all are great.  It's the entertainment that was truly disgusting.  My wife and I made it to the stage area downstairs and tried to listen to the band before giving up a leaving.  The idea of playing various songs and interacting with the crowd is great idea and great response.  BUT the main member of the Band is very crude and disgusting!  Can he not play a song without grabbing his crotch and cussing like that to people!?  One lady even tried to buy him a drink, and he told her, with several vulgar words, he didn't want that!  If she can't bring him  'x', then just get out!
I've seen this singer before, but don't remember him being that vulgar!  Time for some new entertainment.  I would think that the Flora-Bama could easily find excellent band/entertainer to fill that position.

resp.text:
Hi Carynn - Thank you for taking time to let us know about your recent visit to the Flora-Bama. On behalf of our team, please let me start by extending my sincerest apologies for the treatment you received from some of our staff. We absolutely do not tolerate this sort of behavior from our employees, and I would like to get a little more info from you if possible. Can you tell me what day/time you were here, any sort of description of what they looked like and/or where in the Flora-Bama did this occur?
Please know your comments have been passed to upper management, as well as our Ownership Team, for further review and action and, any additional info you may have would be helpful so that we may address this with the appropriate staff. Again, I'm so very sorry this happened but I would love to try and make things right. Please feel free to reach out to me directly with any other info you have using the following email address: blakeli@florabama.com.
I hope to hear back from you soon - Blakeli Calvert, Marketing Manager Flora-Bama

name: Ron Burg
text: Don't even think about coming here if you're under the age of 21. When entering they will mark your hands with U's and place a bright colored wristband on you (which is completely reasonable, I'm not upset about this). The night I visited was an extremely rainy night and it is necessary to go outside to get from one area to another. The markers they use to place U's on your hands WILL come off your hand if any water at all comes in contact with the ink. I was rudely stopped by a security guard about having very little markings on my hand, even though you could still see part of them. When showing him my wristband indicating I was under the age of 21 and not having a drink in my hand, I was told to follow him and was kicked out of the resteraunt (I even let him check my wallet to prove I wasn't trying anything sneaky). Was a total waste of $15 and I will never be visiting again. Staff was very unpleasant to deal with and I was threatened to have the cops called on my friends and I when I asked about their policies. Very rude and I was not happy with my experience. I was excited to enjoy live music with a few friends but was not able to do this because of the terribly rude staff. I will be letting anyone who plans on visiting this area not to pay a visit to this resteraunt/bar.
